86.text: Also, the southern side of this place is Ban Pul and the end of the lands of Hind, and some of the lands of Makran, and the north is Ghazna and Takinabad and Zabulistan. There is a tall mountain on the north side of Makran that is called Taftan, and on top of that mountain is a cave, and that place is Nushadir, and at all times a flame of fire comes ignited from that cave, and the steam of Nushadir sits and closes on the stones and earth around the cave, and it gathers, and that cave has become a divan and has been contracted, and the workers of that cave wear felt and cover their bodies in felt [and run lightly and have a spade of iron and strike at it and separate it. And if they throw a stone in that cave, it falls out of the cave's hole when it gets hot.

86.label: text
86.text: After that is Sistan, and Tabas, and Velayat-e Arba'a, and Kerman, and Sirjan. In Velayat-e Arba'a, Bardasir, Ardashir Babakan has built many structures.³ But this saying that in Bam there was a worm that gave forty *mann* of milky rice every day, and that worm was an apple that had grown so big, this is not reasonable.

86.label: text
86.text: ²- This section has been added from the Russian version.

87.label: text
87.text: It is not because any animal's *hayūlā* whose original nature is small will not grow large, and its creation and body are relative to the matter from which it came into being. For example, no sheep can become the size and shape of a camel, and a sparrow cannot become like a hen, and a worm whose substance of nature is a rotten apple will not reach this level, like other fruit worms and will die the same day, and when a worm comes into being from the moisture of fruit, it will never eat a green leaf or anything other than fruit, and it is impossible for an animal that comes from fruit to live for three months.

87.label: text
87.text: After that, there is an animal that they call *aknus*, and it is the size of a large cat and is red in color, as many as they are, they do not separate from each other and do not go alone, and in the area of Kerman and Khabis, which is the border of Zabulistan, they point out that they attack leopards and hyenas and wolves and other large animals and beasts together, and each one takes a position on the animal's body and makes a prey.

87.label: text
87.text: After that, once in the fortress of Kerman and the fortress of Sirjan, which is fifty years ago in this era from that date, they found a vessel that they had hidden in the ground, and there was something black in it, and from that compound they put a piece on the stone, it would break easily, and if they threw it on the ground, it would sink, and the wells of the fortress were sunk to that distance with the help of that compound. One of those compound medicines was for the blood of every horse. After that, when they destroyed it, they knew what its benefit was.

87.label: text
87.text: After that, there was an ancient city between Kerman and Zabulistan, which they called Sakza-ye, and water came from between two mountains and branched into two and the border of Khabis near the village of Saif, which they call “Deh Saif,” reaches and a lake

87.label: text
87.text: بعد از آن شهری بود قدیم در میان کرمان و زابلستان که آن را سکزه

87.label: text
87.text: ی گفتند و آبی از میان دو کوه میآمد و به دوشاخ میشد و سرحد خبيص نزديك قرية سيف كه آن را « ده سیف میخوانند ، میرسد و دریاچه ای

87.label: text
87.text: *Asl*: *penhan be jay-e fana* (hidden instead of destroyed).

88.label: text
88.text: appeared and many buildings were built and populated from it, and a branch went to the north of Yazd and Maybod and many places were populated from it, it passed from the foothills of a hill that is called *zāj* and went to near Nain. And a group called that water Rud-e Sakza and some Kaseh Rud, and before the Nishapuri earthquake, for quite a while there was a severe earthquake and from both sides of this mountain from which the water came, the stones broke and the valley was filled and the water stopped and the city of Sakza, which was populated by that water, was destroyed and other villages and buildings that were on the edge of those two branches of water were completely destroyed and became uninhabited and the lake on the border of Khabis and Deh Saif dried up and this time they call that place Shahr-e Lut, while Shahr-e Lut is in Syria, and the course of that other branch that went to Yazd was covered with sand, and in the north of Yazd there are still several hills that are called Rang-e Sakza.

88.label: text
88.text: Once Esfandiyar, son of Garshasp, stayed for a few days in the foothills of *Zāj* Mountain and on the edge of Kaseh Rud and founded a city and named it Esfandiyar, and this is a small village and they call it Esfanjud and some of it is covered with sand and the length and width of those colors and hills is about three or four *farsangs* and they call it Rig-e Dir. They say that one of the disciples of Jesus had arrived in that area and built a monastery and the Girans of that province destroyed it and its name remained.

88.label: text
88.text: After that, the middle of the world is Ma'mura-ye 'Alam, which they call Qubbat al-Arḍ and Sitrat al-Arḍ, and some of the cities of Iraq and Khorasan, those that are northern

88.label: text
88.text: and a few southern places that are Fars and Basra.

88.label: text
88.text: ¹ Russian version: Zaraj Kuh instead of *zāj*. ² *Asl*: *tafiqa* ³- Russian version: Zaraj. *Asl* Esfajud correction from the Russian version and the National Library version.

89.label: text
89.text: When Ardashīr Bābakān conquered Fārs, he ordered many structures and strong fortresses to be built.

89.label: text
89.text: Ardashīr was extremely wise, perfect, prudent, and brave. One time, he fled, and an army came after him to capture him. They asked a Zoroastrian Bāzyār about Ardashīr's whereabouts, asking when he had passed by and how many people were with him, as they were going to capture him. Bāzyār said, "You cannot capture him, because he is a world-conquering king." They all became despondent and asked Bāzyār for his reason. He said, "I heard from a Hīrbad that any rider who gallops his horse in the desert, and a deer runs before him, sometimes bowing its head and dragging its antlers on the ground, that rider is a world-conquering king." As he was galloping his horse, he saw a deer running before him in this manner. So, the army turned back

89.label: text
89.text: After Ardashīr conquered Fārs, the soldiers demanded their wages.

89.label: text
89.text: He wanted to distribute them but could not avoid giving them to the soldiers, so he became very thoughtful and sad and promised the soldiers.

89.label: text
89.text: One day, he was leaning against the صف‌ها (suffahs/platforms) when he saw a black snake going into a hole above the roof

89.label: text
89.text: of the suffah. He told the people to bring the snake out and kill it, and to break the wall. They found a great treasure and distributed it among the soldiers. On the same day, a tailor who was the tailor of the nobles of that region said that several boxes of jewels and precious clothes had been placed before me.

89.label: text
89.text: And they say that Ardashīr Bābakān invented backgammon. The statement in the Shāhnāma by Firdawsī that Buzurjmihr invented backgammon in response to chess is incorrect. Perhaps they wanted to send something in exchange for chess, so they sent backgammon. That is, we also have a game. And this ḥadīth is evidence that backgammon

90.label: text
90.text: Ardashīr made it, as he said: «من لعب بالنرد شير كمن غمس بده بلحم

90.label: text
90.text: However, in Iṣṭakhr of Fārs, there is a place called Kinārah, where several very tall stone columns have been built, each column consisting of three pieces of stone. They are very delicate and pleasing, carved, smoothed, and polished, and other shapes and forms have also been carved from stone. The common people call it Chihil Minār (Forty Minarets) and say that Jamshīd built it, intending to build a palace on top of it. In Arabic histories, there is mention of the palace of Ardashīr in Fārs, and it is famous, but we have not identified anything except this Chihil Minār, which they call the palace of Ardashīr. [And there is another mountain where many designs and images have been made, and stone has been carved, and it is called Kūh-i Naghasht, meaning things have been written on it.] The water that irrigates the area of Kalbār, whatever is excess, gathers in the east of a mountain called Surkh Kunbān, forming a lake that is twelve farsangs in length and width, and it is called Daryā-yi Khair

90.label: text
90.text: That place is salty ground, and it has turned the fresh water salty. The great city of Fārs, which is Shīrāz, was built in the time of Islam, several years before Baghdad, and its name was Shīr Sāz, where livestock would descend. And on the southern side of Fārs, there is a desert near the village of Khabr, and

90.label: text
90.text: The tomb of Jāmāsp Ḥakīm is there, and despite the fact that Jāmāsp Ḥakīm was of the Zoroastrian religion

90.label: text
90.text: ¹- This part was added from the Russian version.

90.label: text
90.text: Today it is also known by this name. Original: ḥayr.

90.label: text
90.text: - Russian version: Kirbāl. Original: khayr.. Paris version: jabr.

91.label: text
91.text: had, and the Magians and Zoroastrians leave the dead to the wind, Jāmāsp has been placed in the ground, and his tomb has been built from pieces of iron stone. Now it is ruined and collapsed, and anyone who takes a piece of iron from there cannot find their way back and cannot bring it with them unless they put it back in its place. Any ruler or official who passes by on horseback in that vicinity will be dismissed and lose their position or die. One day, Shaykh Jamāl Baṣrī, who was Īdar Chāgh, when Sulṭān Ghāzān, who was the ruler in Fārs, was passing by the tomb of Jāmāsp on horseback, the nobles said, "Let us turn the road or dismount." He did not listen or pay attention and said, «هذا من فنارات العجم » and passed by. In that same year, he was dismissed and died.

91.label: text
91.text: Afterwards, there are two places in the province of Fārs that are called Buwān, and it is said that God Almighty created four paradises in the world: Ghūṭah of Damascus, Nahr al-Uballah of Basra, Shiʿb Buwān of Fārs, and Sughd of Samarqand. Due to its extreme purity and freshness, it is called the paradise of the world. However, of these two Buwāns in the province of Fārs, one is between Yazd and Shīrāz, and to the east of Abrqūh, which is called Buwān-i Kirmān, and the other Buwān is on the side of Nawbandjān, which is one of the four paradises of the world.

91.label: text
91.text: After that, a plague fell in Khūzistān, and many men and women

91.label: text
91.text: died, and the rest had their brains scrambled and became mad. According to the rule «الجنون فنون, the requirement of their madness was that they would not wear any clothes, saying, "We are so lighter and we can do things easier and better and we do not need to buy clothes." There was a sage among them who ate and drank suitable foods and protected

92.label: text
92.text: and treated his heart and brain and wore clothes according to his custom. The people of that region unanimously said that this ḥakīm is crazy, meaning he wears clothes unlike us.

92.label: text
92.text: Ḥajjāj bin Yūsuf appointed Kaylī and sent him to govern Isfahan, saying, "You are going to a city where 'its soil is kohl, its flies are bees, and its grass is saffron.'" Similarly, about Hamadan, they have said that the land is saffron, the walls are honey, and the air is oil, meaning walnuts and almonds.

92.label: text
92.text: After that, there is a place in Lorestan where a branch of the Zardeh Khānān water, which goes to Shushtar, separates and comes to Isfahan, and they call it Zendeh Rūd. And there is a spring of water that if locusts appear in a city or place, someone who has never committed immorality or sin takes some water from the spring and does not put it on the ground at all, and hangs it on a tripod in the houses, and a bird appears, and some say that it comes with the water, and that bird is called zurzūr in Arabic, and sār in Persian, and some call it kāsīneh karū. It pecks at the locusts with its beak and throws them away, and it also pecks at old women. And whenever this bird sees pain or harm, it eats olives and gets well.

92.label: text
92.text: But then, when a ḥakīm saw in Rome that a zurzūr had fallen, it was making a moaning sound. The ḥakīm saw that other birds of its kind were coming and bringing three olives, one in its beak and two in its claws, and putting them in front of it. That ḥakīm built a high place in Rome and constructed a bird-shaped figure out of copper and a device in it so that when the wind came and hit it, it would make a sound like

92.label: text
92.text: ۱- اصل : زرده خاقان . تصحیح از نسحه کتابخانه ملی ، نسخه روسیه و پاریس زرده جانان .

93.label: text
93.text: A moaning sound would come from that talisman bird, and he had built it in such a way that if he put some olives there, it would slip and fall into a hole, and he had built a reservoir under it, and all the birds of its kind would come from that vicinity and each would bring three olives and put them in front of it, and they would fall into that reservoir hole. After the death of the ḥakīm, it became a dīvān, and thirty thousand *man* of olives were contracted for each year.

93.label: text
93.text: But then, in the west of Shushtar, there is a place called Dar Pol, and it is a large village, and they have built a *qanṭarah* that is three hundred and fifty *gaz*. There are many such large *qanṭarahs* in the world. But they say that they have melted lead and put stones in the middle of it and erected the columns of the *qanṭarah*.

93.label: text
93.text: And on the south side in Dar Pol is the tomb of Dāniyāl the Prophet, who was the originator of *raml*, and he appeared during the caliphate of ʿUmar, and his tomb is made of glass. Wherever his burial place was, there would be a lot of rain. One night, the people of Dez Pol came to Shushtar and took his tomb and buried it in this place, which was beside a flowing water. The water increased and fell on the grave and passed over it, and now four columns have been erected on four sides of Dāniyāl's grave and covered, and another grave has been built opposite his tomb, and many fish gather there and no one catches them and they do not run away from people. And from Dez Pol to the tomb of Dāniyāl [the Prophet], peace be upon him, is seven *farsang*

93.label: text
93.text: And after that, there is a city located on the shore of a gulf that stretches from the Sea of Oman. But then, when they pass this place, there is Baghdad, Madāʾin, Kufa, Hīt, Anbār, and the desert of Babylon where the well of Hārūt and Mārūt is located, and

93.label: text
93.text: in the south of Kufa, Najaf and the people of Bādiyat Ḥijāz .

94.label: text
94.text: And the Tāq Kisrā, which is in Madāʾin, is made of brick and plaster, and it is eighty *gaz* long and sixty *gaz* wide, and the front of the arch is broken and cracked on both sides to the ground. Madāʾin was a large city, and the army of Islam destroyed it, and from the arch to the Shaṭṭ Dijla is about three hundred steps, and there was a bridge there. One of the Akāsireh died and his son was placed on the throne. One day, the sound of a conflict came from the bridge. The son asked, "What is this conflict?" They said, "A group of people from both sides with goods and animals have met in the middle of the bridge and cannot pass each other." The prince said, "Build another bridge next to it and specify that whoever comes from that side should pass from this bridge and from this side to that side, so that no people should pass each other." The commanders and ministers were very happy and showed joy and scattered trays of gold, saying that the judgment he had made had not occurred to any sane person and no one had thought of it. And after that, when the army of Islam came and destroyed Madāʾin and Yazdegerd fled, they found much of the wisdom of the Greeks, and ʿUmar said, "These books are of no use to us, and the book of the Quran is enough for us." They destroyed all of them and

94.label: text
94.text: But then, they founded Baghdad, and there was a large garden that they had designed, and it would not be good without adding that garden, and the owner would not sell or give that garden, and they did not want to take it from him by force, and several days passed. After that, they satisfied the owner of the garden, and he gave the garden, and it was said on the tongue of the workers and a group of non-Arabs who had come from around that "*Bāgh dādeh*" and became famous by this name.

94.label: text
94.text: And it is mentioned in history that they had built an arch on the head of the Dijla water, which was a *qanṭarah*

95.label: text
95.text: There was a bridge, and people would cross that bridge, and this was before the construction of Baghdad. The city of Hilla was built before Baghdad, and the water of the Euphrates, which comes from the direction of Rome, passes through Hilla, and a branch of it has been brought to Baghdad, and they cultivate with it, and they call it the Nahr ‘Īsā, and another branch has been taken by the Sahib al-Diwan to Kufa. And from Hilla to Kufa was ten leagues, and in between there is a Dami which they call Biʾr Mallāja, and Dhūʾl-Kifl, peace be upon him, is placed in Biʾr Mallāja, and from Kufa to Najaf, which is the edge of the desert wilderness, is one and a half leagues.

95.label: text
95.text: When the religion of the Prophet, may God bless him and grant him peace, gained strength, and many mosques, pulpits, and minarets were built, and the name of Muṣṭafā was mentioned on top of the minarets, the commanders and world conquerors of the surrounding areas and some learned, eloquent people envied that this fortune and happiness that Muḥammad, peace be upon him, had been given, why was it not given to us, and they conspired and agreed with each other and wanted to destroy and eliminate the religion of Islam. They never found any opportunity. And among them, a group from the city of Sabaʾ, which is in Yemen, conspired during the caliphate of Shāh Wilāyat that we should go to Kufa and oppose, and make the killing of ‘Uthmān a pretext, and say that ‘Alī is God, and the Commander of the Believers will like it and strengthen us, and when a force gathers against us, a power will appear to us and we will overthrow this religion. So they came to Kufa and founded this meaning and misled a people

95.label: text
95.text: The Commander of the Believers, peace be upon him, was informed. He ordered them to be killed.

95.label: text
95.text: ¹ Russian version: baʿd instead of pīsh.

96.label: text
96.text: and burned them, and a group of simple-hearted people did not know that this was a trick they had done and said that if we had any doubt that ‘Alī is God, now there is no doubt that God kills and burns people.

96.label: text
96.text: The point is that God Almighty has created three people as a place of trial for creatures: Ādam, Nūḥ, and ‘Alī. From the existence of Ādam, the infidelity and disobedience of Iblīs became apparent, and from Nūḥ, after a thousand years of invitation, they knew that that people did not have the capacity for faith, and from the existence of ‘Alī, those who were infidels and hypocrites and Muslims were distinguished from each other. And a group called him God. And some gave him the title of the Seal of the Saints, and some cursed him, and the most correct saying is that the burial place of all three is in Najaf, and from Najaf to Madīnat Rasūl, may God bless him and grant him peace, is one hundred and eight leagues, and from Najaf to Mecca is two hundred leagues, and it is called the Arabian Peninsula, and this area is half within the third clime and the other half within the second clime, and there is little cultivation.

96.label: text
96.text: After Babylon is the district of Hīt and Anbār, and whoever goes to the well of Babylon

96.label: text
96.text: knows something of magic and trickery, but it is harmful to the Muslim religion, and from Hīt and Anbār to the well of Babylon is a bad and unsafe and deadly road, and there is no path or

96.label: text
96.text: But afterwards, in the time of ignorance, they wrote a script in which a letter was two or three madds?

96.label: text
96.text: And a person from Hīt and Anbār reduced that old script and brought it in a way that is now called Kufic, and several people from the Quraysh of Mecca and from the side

96.label: text
96.text: ¹- The word imtiḥān (test) was added from the Paris version. Correction from the text of the Russian and National Library and Paris versions. ³ Paris

97.label: text
97.text: Others came and learned and became famous, and after that Ibn Muqla wrote in this way

97.label: text
97.text: which is famous today and they call it the script of the pious. After that, when they pass this aforementioned place, it is the coast of the Sea of Qulzum, which they call Lisān al-Baḥr, and the coast of the Sea of Frang and Rome and the land of Egypt, lies between these two coasts. Qulzum is a city, and Alexandria and Damiata and Qayshara⁴ are in the middle of the coast of the Sea of Frang, and Ṭūr Mūsā, peace be upon him, is on the coast of the Sea of Qulzum, and the country that lies between these two seas is very prosperous and has many creatures and all kinds of blessings and all kinds of medicines and goods and fruits. And in the districts of Syria there is a plant that they call Sirāj Quṭrub, which gives light at night, and whoever pulls that plant out of its roots will die immediately, and that plant has many properties, and when they approach that plant at night, it gives no light, and during the day, it cannot be distinguished either. They take some ash and throw it from afar on top of that plant that gives light, and they make a dog hungry and come during the day and empty the surroundings of that plant and tie a stone to its roots and throw bread in front of the stone so that the stone does not reach it, and it tries to pick up the bread. The plant pulls out from the roots

97.label: text
97.text: and the stone dies at that moment. And some say that it is yabrūḥ al-ṣanam

97.label: text
97.text: that when they pull it out, they die, and the root of burūḥ al-ṣanam looks like a human being

97.label: text
97.text: but Sirāj Quṭrub is something else, and perhaps burūḥ al-ṣanam also has that property.

97.label: text
97.text: And there is another plant in the province of Syria that turns silver into gold when rubbed against it

97.label: text
97.text: ¹- Original: “mashhūra maẕkūr (famous, mentioned),” and none of the versions have the word mashhūra (famous). In the “M” version and the Russian version: “they do not see” instead of “does not give.”

98.label: text
98.text: می شود . کیمیاگر آن را تربیتی میکند و اکسیر میسازد .

98.label: text
98.text: و در ملك فارس و کرمان و شام گیاهی است که برگ بزرگ پهن برزمین می اندازد و یکی چون تیر راست از میان بر می آید که چون آن يك شاخ را از زمین بر کشند دوحب دارد ، یکی بر بالا و یکی به زیر ، به هم پیوسته . آن حب بالاقوت باه میدهد و اگر عنین بخورد رجولیتش پدید آید و آن يك دانه از زیر بعكس باشد .

98.label: text
98.text: و مشهور است که در دمشق آب روان در خانه ها باشد و مسجدی است بغایت معمور و دوازده هزار پیغمبر در محراب مسجد دمشق مدفونند و شهری درمیان بعلبك وفلسطين ودمشق و عسقلان افتاده است و آن را طبریه میخوانند و آبی میآید و بحیره ای ظاهر گشته و آن را دریای طبریه

98.label: text
98.text: و دیگر ملك مصر و شام ولایت بسیار دارد و چیزهای بس عجیب

98.label: text
98.text: و غریب باشد و بعضی خدای تعالی آفریده و بعضی ساخته اند حکما همه به امر و تقدیر خدای تعالی .

98.label: text
98.text: و درمیان شام و حجاز شهری است که آن را تیما می خوانند و حصنی بغایت محکم دارد از سنگهای ملون و عربان آن را حصن ابلق میخوانند و آن را سلیمان ساخته است و اشعار بسیار به وصف آن گفته اند

98.label: text
98.text: بعد از آن مناره اسکندریه ، چیزی بغایت عجیب ساخته اند . و

98.label: text
98.text: یکی از عجایب دنیا مناره اسکندریه است و اصل آن از آبگینه بود و شکلی ساخته اند بغایت بزرگ و در میان دریا و آب نهاده اند

98.label: text
98.text: و بر پشت آن بنیاد مناره از آبگینه کردهاند و از جانب مناره تا کناره زمین قنطره ها از آبگینه ساخته اند و چهارصد و پنجاه گز بلندی آن منار است

99.label: text
99.text: غلیظ و قوی کرده بودند ، چنانچه سیصد و شصت و پنج قنطره از جوانب مناره از زیر تا بالا ساخته اند و بر بالای مناره آینه ای بزرگ روشن بود که هر کس در آنجا بودی تالون جامه و عدد ایشان همه را می نمود و در آن آئینه می دیدند . قریب سیصد و بیست فرسنگ است تا به قسطنطنیه و چون از روم و فرنگ لشکری عزیمت محاربه میکردند ، تا با مسلمانان جنگ کنند ، چون در حرکت می آمدند ، اهل اسکندریه را معلوم بوده ، به کارسازی و دفع و جواب اشكر مشغول میشدند . فرنگبان میخواسته اند که حیله کنند و آن آینه را خراب سازند یکی از خلفا که به اسکندر به رفته بود می گویند که خلیفه ای از آل عباس بود . جاسوسی ، فرنگیان فرستادند بر سبیل درویشی تا در آن خانه های منار اسکندریه مجاور شد و به خلیفه گفت که در زیر این مناره گنج اسکندر است بفرمود تا آن را خراب گردانیدند تا قعر دریا و آب ، شکل سرطانی یافتند از مس و هیچ گنج نبود و چون آن شخص را طلب کردند گریخته بود . دانستند که آن جاسوس از فرنگ بوده و حیله کرده . پس خلیفه بفرمود تا استادان بنا را بیاورند ، تا باز مناره بر آوردند و آخر از گچ و آجر ساختند دو دانگ آنچه اول بود . اما بعد ، به ده فرسنگی مصر قصبه ای هست که آن را « عین الشمس » میخوانند [ و باغی قریب سیصد و سی قصبه که هفت قفیز بود در آن عين الشمس است و در آنجا درخت روغن بلسان بر آمده و آن درخت را در جابهای دیگر می برند و می کارند میروید اما روغن نمیدهد و آن يك موضع معین است . و افیون و دیگر داروهای نافع در جبال مصر باشد وسقنقور و مقناطیس و زر و نقره و میوه های فراوان و بسیار باشد و از آن جمله ثمره درختی است

99.label: text
99.text: ۱- این قسمت از نسخه روسیه افزوده شد

100.label: text
100.text: که چون در میان طعام کنند بغایت فربه میشوند چنانچه حکایت کرده اند که زنان مصر سیصد من و چهار صد من میشوند بغایتی که تردد نمی توانند کرد و محتاج کنیزکانند و از فربهی میمیرند و بعضی شوهران با ایشان مباشرت نمیتوانند کردن و در دو طرف دیوار خانه صفه ای است و بر آن دو حلقه هست و طنابی بر آن بسته اند دو پای زوجه را بر می کشند ، هريك به طرفی و بعد از آن عمل می کنند . بعد از آن اهرام است و آن گنبدهای بزرگ است و حکمای سلف ساخته اند و مسافت آن مواضع که گنبدها بر آورده اند ده فرسنگ باشد و آنچه کوچکتر است ، نسبت با گنبدهائی که در عالم ساخته بودند بغایت بزرگتر است و بعضی از آن را خراب کرده اند و مجموع آن از سنگ است . و در زمان یوسف پیغمبر علیه السلام طعمها از بهر محافظت در آنجا می نهادند . و از آن جمله سه گنبد بزرگ است و دو گنبد از سیوم بزرگتر است و از سنگ ساخته اند و هر پاره از سنگ ده گز طول و هشت گز عرض دارد . و آن

100.label: text
100.text: دو گنبد بزرگتر هرمانین است . و هريك از این هرمان چهارصد گز طول و چهار صدگز عرض دارد و چهارصدگز سمك ارتفاع است و مربع ساخته اند و سر مر آن دو گنبد دایره وار به هم آورده اند و چنان لطیف و پاکیزه نهاده اند که بهتر از آن تصور نتوان و در هیچ جا پیدا نه و در حوالی آن دو گنبد بغایت مکتوبات به خط مجهول نوشته اند ، بغایت مطبوع و دلپذیر و بر بلندی است و در یکی مدفن عاد [ و ] ثمودست و دیگر مدفن هرمس الهرامسه است که شیث و ادریس پیغمبر است علیهما السلام و در میان آن دو گنبد موضعی چند فرو برده و عماراتی چند ساخته و گنبد سیوم ربع آن دو گنبد باشد یعنی سیصد

100.label: text
100.text: ۱- اصل : سمت . اصلاح از نسخه های پاریس و روسیه و معنی عبارت روشن

101.label: text
101.text: Goz in three hundred _goz_, and they have made it in such a way that it has a red color, and they say that a group that built this dome said that destroying it is more difficult than building it.

101.label: text
101.text: In any case, we built it, let them destroy it. Meaning they cannot.

101.label: text
101.text: And they say there was a Muslim king in Egypt, and a sheikh invited him to destroy the pyramids, and he was outraged that he could destroy these domes. He summoned all the well-diggers and laborers, and most of the people of Egypt agreed, and they spent a lot of money and spent some time destroying the smaller dome, but they could not destroy a little of it, so that it does not appear at all from a distance, and when they get close, that destruction seems to be something scratched. He asked the master builder, “Can what you have dug from this smaller dome be repaired with a thousand dinars?”

101.label: text
101.text: He said, "A thousand dinars will be spent on one stone, and it will not be so delicate and pleasing." And in that vicinity there are several enduring pyramids that are very far away, so that as far as they go down, they do not reach the bottom, and they say that the stones from which the domes are made were taken out from there.

101.label: text
101.text: And also in this area there is a single piece of stone in the middle of the desert that is ten _goz_ by ten _goz_, and its height is eight _goz_, and a place two _goz_ by two _goz_ has been dug in the middle of the stone, and around that stone on all four sides every shape and form and industry with tools and instruments of every foreman and equipment that is in the world has been depicted, and their purpose was that if a storm comes to the world and the world is destroyed, the sciences and industries will not be lost from the hands of the people, but they should look at those images and patterns and infer and know that the equipment and shapes were in the world, and earn. And they say that if someone wants to subdue a type of human or animal, he must stay there for a year, because every year there is a time when those images move

102.label: text
102.text: they do or it seems so in the eyes of the beholders, when he puts a piece of wax in that desired image, it takes shape and keeps it with him, it becomes subdued to him. A _khwāja_ from Abarqūh related that once a dervish came and my father went to see him, after that he wanted to give him a feast, the dervish did not allow it, he went into the house and immediately came back and brought all kinds of food and sweets and put it down, he was surprised. After a few days, he asked about the dervish. They said that he had died and had ordered that such-and-such sealed bag should be given to such-and-such _khwāja_. When they gave me that bag, I opened it in the house, I found a piece of wax that had an image on it. Immediately I saw a terrible blackness that had appeared. He said, "What is the service?" I was afraid and that wax fell from my hand, in that moment he picked it up and disappeared. After that I knew what the benefit was. I regretted very much that that dervish had subdued the spiritual beings.

102.label: text
102.text: But after that, a pond has been built in Egypt and a way has been made to the water of the Nile and several figures have been drawn so that when the water is increased or decreased, it is known from that figure, and the high and low prices of Egypt depend on the water, and there may be days when the price changes two or three times, and all the time they ask about the state of the water of the Nile in Egypt, whether it is increasing or decreasing. If there is abundance in Egypt and its surroundings, it is very good, and if there is scarcity, it is difficult, and the reason is that there are no _kārīz_ and springs of water in Egypt, and they can cultivate and sow only when the water of the Nile has decreased, and the increase and beginning of the tides of the Nile are in the summer, when other days it decreases and the desert of Egypt is all colors, and when the water of the Nile increases from the deserts of the equator and Abyssinia and Berber, a few black mud comes with the water and settles on that sand, and when in the autumn season the water decreases and those places of black mud are settled on the sand, they sow seeds and

103.label: text
103.text: the income arrives at the end of the spring season when the tides have not yet started. And if in a year the water of the Nile increases a little, they cannot sow much seed and famine appears and this place cannot be called a homeland. Because in other areas water comes from _kārīz_ and springs all the time and in that season they can sow a little that is enough to keep them alive

103.label: text
103.text: And this is not the case in Egypt.

103.label: text
103.text: The Story of the Famine of Egypt

103.label: text
103.text: When the conjunction of the upper planets around the year _tisʿīn va ḫams māʾa_ transferred from the earthy triplicity to the airy triplicity, it was the first conjunction that occurred in the sign of Libra. All seven planets made a conjunction together. Astronomers said that a storm of wind would arise that would destroy all the buildings of the inhabited quarter. When such a rumor of conjunction spread in the world, people became frightened and built places in the basements and went to streams and wells and took valuables and necessities. When the conjunction occurred, there was no wind and the air did not move at all, they were surprised, because the sign of Libra has the image of a human being, it should have been judged that a strong wind would come. Although Libra is an airy sign, so that many people would be destroyed, although it has the image of a human being. _Khwāja Naṣīr al-Dīn Ṭūsī_ says that I wanted to say what sign would appear in the world from the effect of this, I went back in reverse, it was a sign of Chingiz Khan, who had more than ten thousand people killed by him and his followers. And another sign occurred in the Maghrib, which was the famine in Egypt and its surroundings, which had never been imagined or heard of.

103.label: text
103.text: A few years before the rise of Chingiz Khan in the year _sabʿ va tisʿīn va_

104.label: text
104.text: وستمایه هجری ، آب نیل نقصان کرد و چنان شد که جزیره ها و تلها از میان آب پدید آمد و در با عفن گشت و طحلب بگرفت ، و قحطی برخاست ، سخت تر از آنکه در زمان یوسف علیه السلام بود . در اوایل قحط ، همه جانوران حلال و حرام بخوردند و بعد از آن مردمان قربه و کودکان را و بعد از آن دست به هم باز زدند و به کسی که فرصت مییافتند می کشتند و می خوردند . و وبائی نیز با قحط پدید آمد که هر روز چندین هزار آدمی می مردند و بعد از آن به مردار خوردن رفتند و به جایی رسید که مرده از گور بیرون می آوردند و میخوردند و هر جا که استخوانی افتاده بود بر میداشتند و میخوردند و بسیار از آن مردم در اطراف روانه شدند و هیچ به مقصد نرسیدند و در راه بمردند . اندکی بود آنچه مجموع گفتیم با آنچه در ولایت مصر هلاک شدند هیچ کس نبود و جمله متروکات آن اقوام هیچ متعرض و متصرف نداشت و در همه مواضع مرده افتاده و گنده شده و شخصی که از موضع بعید به مشاهده آمده بود تقریر کرد که هر کجا که رفتم ، هیچ آواز نشنیدم و هیچ کس را ندیدم همچنانکه ولمن الملك اليوم الله الواحد القهار و همۀ آن صحرا سبع گرفت و آن قحط به ملك شام و اسكندريه رسید و بسیار آدمی بمردند و قحط و و با چنان گشت که به دیدن و دم در کشیدن و دم و نفس یکدیگر شنیدن می مردند و در تاریخ میآید که بعضی پنداشتندی که تندرستند و در يك صنعت و حرفت که زمان آن دو ساعت باشد چندین کس به جای یکدیگر می ایستادند و پیاپی می مردند و این و با و قحط در مجموع ولایتها و شهرهای مصر و شام برسید و شهر قدس نسبت با شهرهای بد بدترین .

104.label: text
104.text: و اگر خلق عالم آنچه چنگیزخان و اتباع ایشان به قتل در آوردند

104.label: text
104.text: می بودند ، این زمان در بسیط جهان جای و مقام مردم تنگ آمدی . مورخان

105.label: text
105.text: میگویند که مبالغه است که اگر تا انقراض عالم توالد باشد و هیچ کس

105.label: text
105.text: نمیرد ، چندان آدمی نشوند که در آن زمان بودند و بمردند .

105.label: text
105.text: و بعد از آن قحط و و با در شام ، زلزله ای سخت شد ، نزديك به زلزله لوط در تاریخ میآید که چنان زلزله ای در شام و حوالی حادث گشت که آب دریا بشکافت و کشتی در بن در یا به زمین آمد و بعد از آن بازگشت و کشتی را بر آورد و موضعی از زمین به موضعی دیگر نقل کرد و دو کوه که در میان آن مسافتی بود به هم پیوست .

105.label: text
105.text: شخصی حکایت کرد که در سنه ثلث و سبعین وستمایه هجری در کرمان و حوالی زلزله ای سخت شد و در خبیص سخت تر بود و بسیاری از واضع و باغ و درخت به موضع دیگر افتاد و در ذی قعده سنه احدی و اربعین و سبعمایه در کرمان زلزله ای دیگر شد و حکایت کردند که دو کوه

105.label: text
105.text: چگونه بود که در حالت زلزله موضعی به موضعی دیگر رود و

105.label: text
105.text: زمین تجویف بسیار دارد و متخلخل است و مسام گشاده و چون بخاری که زلزله به سبب اوست تولد میکند و میخواهد که بیرون آید ، موضعی را از زمین سوراخ کند [ و بشکافد و آن موضع که از هم باز بود البته از طرفی اجزای زمین بر هم نشبند و محکم گردد و آن مقدار از زمین

105.label: text
105.text: ۱- این قسمت از نسخه روسیه افزوده شد .

106.label: text
106.text: که شکافته باشد ، زمین به زمین دیگر و کوه به کوه ديگر نزديك آيد . مثلا اگر نجاری دری از چوب تر بسازد و تخته محكم بر هم زند ، چون خشك شود میان لوح گشاده شود . از آن است که اجزای آبی به بخار رفته و اجزای

106.label: text
106.text: چوب جای آن گرفته و برهم نشسته .

106.label: text
106.text: مثال دیگر آنکه اگر سنگی سخت برزمین زنند ، البته گوی پیدا شود و به مقدار حجم سنگ از گل خالی گردد . مع هذا آن گل به هیچ جا نرفته ، بلکه اجزای گل به هم نشسته و تراکم پذیرفته

106.label: text
106.text: اما بعد در ناحیه مصر شهری هست که کیسوم می خوانند و موضعی که حصن منصور میخوانند . و میانۀ آن آبی بزرگ می آید و قنطره بر سر آن بسته اند که آن را قنطره سنجه میخوانند و آن قنطره يك طاق مفرد است

106.label: text
106.text: به مسافت دویست گام و آن را از سنگ رخام ساخته اند و هر پاره سنگ ده گز درازی دارد و پنج گز عرض و از جوانب این طاق ، دو طاق دیگر كوچك بسته اند که نسبت با طاق این زمان بزرگ است و غرض از این طاقها آن است که اگر وقتی آب بسیار باشد و رودخانه بر او تمام آید ، از دو جانب قنطره آبی چند بگذرد و صدمه آن را بشکند و گفته اند که چیزی عجب که

106.label: text
106.text: در دنیا ساخته اند یکی قنطره سنجه است

106.label: text
106.text: و بعد از آن درمیان غربی و شمالی ملک مصر ، ملك يونان است و کوهی بلند در غایت شمالی یونان بود در ساحل دریا و می گفتند که این کوه حجاب بادشمال است و از راه بر می باید داشت . و داروئی ساختند هم از آن ترکیب که گفتیم که در قلعۀ کرمان و سیر رجان ظرفی یافتند که برکوه و سنگ میزدند سست میشد و میکندند ، آن کوه به تمام ببریدند و از راه برگرفتند . و بعد از چند سال مدود در یا بیش از قاعده پدید آمد و در ملك يونان افتاد و دریا شد .

107.label: text
107.text: And in a history, it is mentioned that Alexander wanted to draw a gulf from the sea to a location, and for that reason, Greece was flooded.

107.label: text
107.text: And the air of Greece is such that whoever passes through that air will recall everything that has happened to them in their entire life.

107.label: text
107.text: Ptolemy the Wise, in his dying state, specified a mountain, saying, "Bury me on top of that mountain, and come on such-and-such day of such-and-such year, for I shall come alive." They wrote down the date, and some people did not believe this statement, and some said, "Ptolemy was a wise and virtuous man; his words cannot be meaningless." They agreed, and on the day he had promised, they went to Ptolemy's grave, and the journey was a distance, taking several days, and in that state, a flood occurred, and people perished, but those who had gone to Ptolemy's grave

107.label: text
107.text: بطلميوس حکیم در حالت رحلت کوهی معین کرد که مرا بر سر آن کوه دفن کنید و فلان روز از فلان سال بیائید که من زنده شوم . تاریخ بنوشتند و جماعتی این سخن را اعتبار نکردند و طایفه ای گفتند بطلمیوس حکیمی فاضل بود ، سخن او بی معنی نباشد . تفاق کردند و در روزی که وعده داده بود ، بر سر قبر بطلمیوس رفتند و مسافتی راه بود ، چند روز برداشت و در آن حالت آب گرفت و مردم هلاک شدند و آنان که بر سر قبر بطلمیوس

107.label: text
107.text: were saved, and they said, "His coming to life was this, that he wanted to save people from drowning."

107.label: text
107.text: After that, in the west of the land of Egypt, two things are said to exist. One, which the people of the world unanimously speak of, is the ʿAnqā-yi Maghrib, which the common Persian speakers call « Sīmurgh », and it is a proverb that no one has ever seen it. The other, which the Jews say, is that they believe there is a city that is five hundred farsangs from Egypt, and two tribes of the Children of Israel are in that city, and every week for six days, sand revolves around that city, and no one can come or go, and on Saturday it stops, and anyone who wants to come and go outside or inside the city cannot. And this is an impossible statement, for if there were such a city, travelers would have reported it, since merchants come and go to the farthest reaches of the east and west at all times.

107.label: text
107.text: Let us say another reason that will be a silent answer to the Jews, so that they have

108.label: text
108.text: no objection or answer remains, for in the religion of Moses, peace be upon him, on Saturday, earning and seeking profit, work, action, and trade are forbidden. If a Jew works on Saturday or seeks worldly gain, he is certainly not a Jew, for with them, working on Saturday is a grave sin. So, a city from which Jews cannot come out except on Saturday—several thousand people and several animals are in that city, and they have essential provisions and necessities—from where do they obtain it, and how do they live? Thus, it became clear that the Jews are lying about it, and no such city exists, and their purpose is to say that our religion is right. Just as the Christians have the same idea, and the Christians' proof is the church, and we will mention it in the Fourth Clime.

108.label: text
108.text: However, after that, to the west of Alexandria, was the land of Greece, and a tall mountain in the north of Greece on the shore of the Frankish Sea, and they said that this mountain should be removed from the path because it is a barrier to the north wind, and when the north wind passes over the sea, no dust or foul vapor will be with it, and the air would be purer, and the sick would recover faster from inhaling the north breeze because the seashore is inside the kingdom of Egypt, and Upper Cairo and Lower Cairo, which are dependencies of Egypt, are also located in that area, and several provinces on the seashore are populated and have many people, and there are two other places on the coast, one of which is called Atu and the other is Tangier, and it is a province that has a distance on the seashore and is the end of the buildings of the Third Clime from the west, and Atu and Tangier have become proverbial. And this saying that the common people say, that go to Tun and Tangier, «Atu wa Tanjah» should be said, because Tun is a city

108.label: text
108.text: from the cities of Khorasan, and this is a famous verse, which is:

108.label: text
108.text: 1- This part has been taken from the Russian version.

109.label: text
109.text: To Tun and to Tangier, to black water,

109.label: text
109.text: To a place where no plant ever grows.

109.label: text
109.text: Whereas in Tun and Tangier there is no black water, and green and

109.label: text
109.text: fresh plants grow abundantly, and there are various flowers, basil, fruits, and delicate blessings. And from it, they extract pearls with shells that have blackness in the middle, and they do not like it, and it has no fame or value, and Allah knows best. Wallahu aʿlam.

110.label: text
110.text: First, a location from the beginning of the eastern construction in the fourth clime, some of the cities of the *moʿarrafān*¹ that we mentioned in the third clime. After that are the lands of the Yellow Robed, between whom and the Tatar there is always war and fighting. On the northern side, which was the end of the fourth clime, from the farthest east, is a mountain that is connected to the Barrier of Yajuj. And the city of the Yellow Robed is located around large mountains, and after that is a lake that they call Ghaghan, and another temple that is the pilgrimage site of the Christians, and this *bast* is called the Smaller Idol, and the Larger Idol, which is their great pilgrimage site, is in the farthest east in the first clime, which we mentioned, and they come from Farang and its surroundings to this temple that we mentioned and perform pilgrimage, and it is nearly one thousand and seven hundred *farsangs*, and around the temple there are many mountains and streams of water, including a very large river that goes to the city of Yajuj and joins the surrounding sea.

110.label: text
110.text: ¹ Russian version: *moʿarrabān*. Paris version: *maʿrūfān*. ² Russian and Paris versions: *moʿāmala* instead of *moqātala*

111.label: text
111.text: After that is the end of the Tatar territory and the beginning of the Khitai territory, and to the north of this location

111.label: text
111.text:
is a mountain that surrounds a body of water, and that is called the Sea of Demons, and that mountain is the source of the Yajuj River. And another sea to the south of the Sea
of Demons is inside the lands of the Tatar, and in this area there are many musk deer, and Tatar musk is famous.

111.label: text
111.text:
But after that, the Khitai lands are two hundred and fifty *farsangs* in length and width, and in it there are a lot of musk, silk, and precious goods, and Khitai musk is better than Tibetan
and Tatar musk, and the sign of Khitai musk is that it weighs about fifteen *mithqals* and has no hair on it, and Tibetan and Tatar musk is small, and the Tibetan and Tatar navel is better than the Chinese, and what is the navel of the Chinese has a lot of hair on it, and in the land of Khitai there is bad faith and metempsychosis and
trickery and deceit are abundant, and they throw the corpses of the dead into the water so that fish and animals may eat them, and some believe that if someone dies in a house, everything in
that house should be given to the washer, and most of the strangers are washers, and in the cities of Khitai, there are thieves and elegists and hypocrites and *mard andāz* and *nār* and many conjurers, and several people agree with each other and one or two of them are intermediaries and brokers and they take the property of a stranger who has arrived there by way of business. And one of their conjuring tricks is that two people have two boxes full of ants, one black and one red, and these two are fighting each other, and each of them has a small drum, and in a place where
there is a viewing spot for people and a crowd of onlookers, they come and put the boxes next to each other and each one beats the drum once, the ants come out from both sides and line up facing each other and stand still, then they beat the drum once more, and that is the war drum. Then the ants attack each other from both sides and wound each other with their teeth and become mixed together like a mountain. After that, when they want

112.label: text
112.text: to separate from each other, they beat the same drum, the ants release each other

112.label: text
112.text:
and go back to the box, and in this way they take something from the people. And most of the cities of Khitai are cold, and a lot of lightning flashes, and sometimes a stone falls from the lightning. As Abu ʿAli took that stone and put it in a crucible to see what comes out of it, everything went out in vapor and nothing remained, and a person narrated that he had seen in Qazvin that a stone came to the ground from the middle of the lightning, and in the era of Abu ʿAli Sīnā, a stone of three hundred *mans* came down from the air, and they found in a history that after Abuʿali Sīnā, a few years later, a stone of fifty *mans* fell from
the sky to the ground. And a person narrated that he had seen in the hot region of Fars that a villager
with firewood was passing by when a round stone came to the ground from the air in front of him, which was about
thirty *mans*. We asked him that it must be apparent that all of its parts
were seated together. He said, yes, that is so, and the reason is that
every vapor that rises from the earth has earthly parts with it, and
in the heavenly effects they say that they have seen chaff with hail, and when earthly parts

112.label: text
112.text: become dense together, they suddenly become heavy and come to the ground.

112.label: text
112.text:
And there are several animals that take on the form of creation and composition
for one hour, and God Almighty creates it for one hour. His saying: *ʾiḏā ʾaradnā šayʾan ʾan yaqūla lahū kun fayakūn* and one of them is a lizard and a snake and a fly.

112.label: text
112.text: ¹ - The (M) version does not have the phrase "in Qazvin." Russian version: in Qazvin. Paris version: In the hot region of Pars, a villager with firewood was passing by when a solitary stone came to the ground from the air, which was about thirty *mans*. Apparently, there is an omission, because later the discussion will be about the hot region of Pars.

113.label: text
113.text: And if from a meadow covered with animal dung, mixed with mud and become rotten, a vapor rises in the spring season, then immediately the earthly elements will take the form of snakes and frogs and rain down, and they will be extremely small. As in the Chagh of Sultan Abu Saʿīd in Sultāniyya and the surrounding areas of Buzgh, it had rained, so that the entire surface of the earth was seen as frogs, and flies also appear in less than an hour. And if someone in the spring season, when the air is extremely temperate, is careful when the tray is full of ripe foods, steam rises from it and if he puts it down, it immediately takes the form of a fly in the air, and if they remove the tray late, it will come and sit on the food. *kull shayʾ yarjiʿu ila aṣlihi* and the sign of that is that some flies are extremely small and transparent. It is also possible for small stones to rain from the air, and the reason for this is that much of the earth turns into stone water.

113.label: text
113.text: Between Kermān and Bam is a place called Rāyīn. One day I was passing by and found streams of stone next to each other. I asked, "What are these stone streams for?" They said, "We have passed water through these streams and they have turned to stone and the streams have become narrow and we have diverted the water to another path, and every few days we have to cut a new stream to

113.label: text
113.text: new must be cut so that the water can pass, because the water turns to stone in a short time. For example, if an earthquake occurs on land that has this property, a vapor will rise, and if there is hail or rain on the way at that moment, as the vapor and rain meet, they will turn to stone and they say that stone has rained. And Abū ʿAlī Sīnā says that

113.label: text
113.text: When God's wrath and torment come upon a people, He gives the elements of the earth so much strength that all animals and plants turn to stone.

114.label: text
114.text: After that, in the mountains of Khitāy, there is a stone called *ḥajar al-maṭar*

114.label: text
114.text: and some are white, some are earth-colored, some are red and piebald, and some people say that it is in their stomachs and is born from there, and when it wants wind and rain and cold and snow and hail to come in a season of the year, they cut that stone and put it there, and this sign appears to the extent that they say that if they want cold and snow and rain on one side and sunshine and good weather on the other side, and each stone is specific to an order of specific signs, and a group believes that they are all one stone, the difference appears in the situation

114.label: text
114.text: Salt is scarce in Khitāy, and the place where salt is found is a month's journey from Khitāy, and there are mostly wells on the way, and several large mountains in the middle of the Khitāy salt desert, that if there were no mountains, the salt route would be shorter, and there is a place like a ladder, step by step, and from the bottom to the top of the mountain, ropes are tied, and pedestrians tie several *man* of salt on their backs and take hold of it and go to the top of the mountain, and from there it is very close to Khitāy, and sometimes the rope breaks or the top of the rope is released, they fall down and perish.

114.label: text
114.text: After that is Delhi, which is the most important city in India, and it is located at the beginning of the fourth clime, and the north of Delhi, which is the end of the fourth clime, is the lands of Turkestan, and a very large mountain stretches between the fourth clime, which is a distance of one hundred *farsangs*, and a lake in the middle of that mountain from the springs that have appeared from all sides, and in the vicinity there were many people and livestock, and most are good-looking and savage, and some of them know less gold and silver

114.label: text
114.text: ۱- این قسمت از نسخه روسیه افزوده شد .

115.label: text
115.text: It is mentioned in a history that a sage was in India, a year or two before Noah's flood,

115.label: text
115.text: he told the people that all seven planets would be in conjunction at the end of the Pisces constellation, and by the command of God Almighty, it seems that so much rain will fall that nothing will remain! No building will remain and all the buildings on earth will be destroyed, and I will teach you a lesson to be saved. He ordered them to prepare many gourds and dry them well, then they found a flat desert and said that these gourds should be placed side by side and wood should be placed around them and fastened with rope, and everyone should make a place for themselves and connect them together and make them into one piece. If what I am saying is so, you will be saved before taking action, and if it does not happen, the gourd, wood, and rope will not go anywhere, and about twelve *farsangs* by twelve *farsangs* of gourds were placed side by side and made into one piece, and each marked their place. When the rain began, the beginning of the rain was on Tuesday until Friday, not a single moment of rest. The creatures of that side each moved to their place and took precious goods and *mā yaḥtāj* and several months' worth of food with them, and when the water overcame, it rose and came to the surface of the water, and they had no news of Prophet Noah, peace be upon him, who had built a ship because Noah's invitation had not reached them. After that, when the water subsided and those people reached the land, no building remained and they did not know what place it was and where they had been before, and they founded a city and that is Delhi, and they say that in their language Delhi means to descend to a place.

115.label: text
115.text: If someone says that Noah the Prophet prayed « رب الاقدر على الأرض من

115.label: text
115.text: ۱- در نسخه ( م ) زر ر شناسند .

116.label: text
116.text: الغافر بن ذیارا و حق تعالی وعده داد که ایشان را به آب غرق کنیم و نوح علیه السلام کشتی ساخت چگونه حکیمی داند که آن طوفان از تأثیر قرآن ستارگان بود در برج آبی ؟

116.label: text
116.text: جواب آن است که حق تعالی هر چیز را سبب چیز دیگر گردانیده . هم چنانکه نماز و روزه و حج و زکوة بر مسلمانان فرض است ، دور و سیر آفتاب و ماه را سبب هم اوقات آن فرایض کرده . بدان گشت دهور و اعوام واسطه روشنی ماه و آفتاب زمان وقت هر فرصتی پدید می آید و ادا

116.label: text
116.text: بعد از آن بارها دیده ایم که در بغداد چهارچوب در از برهم می بندند . و هر چهار طرف خيك باد كرده بر آن چوبها بند می کنند و ده پانزده هزار رطل بر او می نهند و مردم بر سر آن مینشینند و بر روی آب دجله می اندازند و از مسافت دور به بغداد میآرند کدوئی که ده من آب در او رود اگر بر سر آب اندازند سیمن بار بردارد و [ خیکی که سی من آب بردارد ] اگر باد بر او کنند و در روی آب اندازند صدمن برگیرد و سبب این آن است که هوا لطیف تر از آب باشد و به يك مرتبه مركز بالاتر باشد .

116.label: text
116.text: اما بعد در اول اقلیم چهارم کشمیر است و در وسط ا اقلیم ، آخر شهرهای ترکستان است و چون کشمیر در میان هندوستان و ترکستان افتاده مردمش نه سیاه و نه سفید باشند و بغایت خوب صورت باشند که قوم آن ولایت با هم پیوند می کنند و آمیخته میشوند و گروهی در اطراف کشمیر

116.label: text
116.text: ۱- این قسمت از نسخه روسیه افزوده شد . ۲ این قسمت از نسخه روسیه

117.label: text
117.text: هستند که ظاهر فرج زنان ایشان دایره وار گرد .است و می گویند که در ناحیه

117.label: text
117.text: و در سنه اربعین و سبعمایه شخصی در کرمان حکایت کرد که امسال در این موضع زنی غریب را دیدم که گدائی میکرد و همچنین که تعریف کردیم بود و نشان و هیأت و صورت او که نشان میداد از ولایت کشمیر

117.label: text
117.text: و بعد از آن باب البرامکه است و آن ولایتی است که در قدیم دین

117.label: text
117.text: مجوس داشتند و قومی متنعم صاحب مروت و صاحب عرض و ناموس بودند و اکابر آن ولایت اتفاق کردند و در بلخ کعبه ای ساختند تا جوابگوی خانه کعبه باشد که حج و زیارت میکنند و اموال و املاك فراوان وقف آن خانه کردند و نيك به تكلف ساخته آمد و کسی که از ایشان به اصل و نسب و جاه و مال معتبر بود حاکم و متولی آن خانه باشد و آن را برمك نام نهادند و این نامی است که به آن خانه منسوب است هم چنانکه بزرگ و رئیس

117.label: text
117.text: قوم را مهتر و سرور میخوانند به لغت ایشان برمك همین معنی دارد . روزی عبدالملک مروان میگفت که از عجم وزیر صاحب عرض و ناموس و عاقل کافی میخواهم که وزارت من کند که عربان طریق وزارت و تدبیر ملک نمیدانند . گفتند بری این برمك خوب است . رسولی را بفرستادند که به اعزاز و اکرام هر چه تمامتر برمك را بياوردند ، به هر کجا رسیدند استقبال می نمودند و پیشکش میآوردند چون بیامد و عبدالملك را بدید در بازوی او سنگی بود که چون کسی زهر داشته باشد آن سنگ در حرکت آید و این سنگ در کله کوههای طرف مغرب هست و با برمك زهر بود . فی الحال عبد الملك گفت که این مجوس را محبوس کنید و بند نهید . برمك تعجب نمود که آن از چه بود و این از چیست چون صورت حال معلوم کرد که

118.label: text
118.text: به چه سبب محبوس شده گفت من زهر از برای خود دارم که ما مردم صاحب عرض و ناموسیم بی عرضی و مشقت نتوانیم کشید و زهر از بهر آن داریم که اگر وقتی نکبتی برسد پیشتر از بی عرضی و تعذیب ، خود را به مرگ بازرهانیم . عبدالملك پسندید و او را از حبس بیرون آورد و حجابت داد و پسر برمك .بود . از زمان عبد الملك مروان تا ابتدای خلافت آل عباس زمان برداشت و خالد مسلمان شد و یحیی پسر خالد و دیگر اولاد

118.label: text
118.text: برمك وزير و معتبر گشتند و به عقل و کنایت و سخاوت مشهور شدند . بعد از آن بدخشان است ، در قدیم لعل نبود و در هیچ کتاب ذکر لعل نکرده اند . گویند زلزله ای در بدخشان شد و کوهها تمام از هم بگسیخت و کان لعل پیدا گشت . اول سرخ بود ، بعد از آن زرد و سبز و

118.label: text
118.text: اما بعد ملك ماوراء النهر است در اول اقلیم چهارم که طرف جنوبی باشد . بعضی از آن کابل و زابل است و در آخر اقلیم چهارم که شمالی بود فرغانه است . و هم چنان که گاوان طوس مشهور بودگاوان فرغانه نیز گویند . وقتی قاضی طوس به فرغانه میرفت . بزرگی دوبیتی از بهر قاضی گفته و مصرع آخرش این است : ع گاوی است کزین خانه بدان خانه رود . » و در ماوراءالنهر گفته اند که پسر دبیر میباید و دختر چنگی . علما و فضلای بسیار میباشند و ابو علی سینا از ماوراءالنهر بود .

118.label: text
118.text: شهری باشد که نخشب میخوانند و گازری از قریه نخشب بود که مقنع نام داشت و شعبده ها و طلسمها وحبلتها بسیار میدانست و می کرد . از جمله چاهی ساخته بود که شکل آفتاب و ماهتاب از آن چاه بر می آورد . گفت من خدایم و جماعتی را میخواست گمراه کند ، قصد او کردند تا

119.label: text
119.text: They wanted to kill him, and they were thinking about his trickery and deceit, that they should go to him at night, lest he might have done some magic trick. Ultimately, matters became difficult for him, and he knew that they would capture and kill him. He frightened them by saying that he would go to heaven, return, and give them an answer. Maqannaʿ's intention was that since they would not see him, fear and apprehension would remain in the people's hearts. He lit a furnace full of fire and heated it intensely, and he killed the slave and the maid he had and buried them under the ground. A little maid escaped from him and hid. Maqannaʿ threw himself into the furnace and burned. After a day or two passed, they did not see Maqannaʿ, and they had no news of him. They investigated and searched for him. The little maid came and said that he had burned himself. When they sought his bones from among the ashes and found them, they knew that he had burned himself.

119.label: text
119.text: But there is another city called Ṣaghāniyān, and there was a scholar in that city who knew the Arabic language well and was known as Ṣaghānī. He wrote a book on language and began with «Alif» and wrote seven hundred names for *asad*. When he reached the letter «Bāʾ,» several volumes had been produced, and he died with the word «bukm». And it became a proverb that Ṣaghānī died with the word *bukm*.

119.label: text
119.text: After that is the kingdom of Khurasan, and it is said that the kingdom of Khurasan is the breast of the prophets and the highest place in the inhabited quarter; Khurasan is *qubbat al-arḍ* and *sutrat al-arḍ* [that is farther from the surrounding seas on all sides, and Khurasan and *qubbat al-arḍ*] were the center of the inhabited world, and most of the cities of Khurasan are very populous and have abundant blessings, and in ancient times it was the seat of kings, and many scholars, sages, sheikhs, elders, and sultans have been from Khurasan. And the city of Ṭūs, which²

120.label: text
120.text: The shrine of Imam ʿAlī Mūsā Riḍā, peace be upon him, is there. They say that by the blessing [of the pure soul of that Hazrat, in Ṭūs, no hen eats filth].¹ Tūn and Qāʾin are in the first part of the fourth clime, and most of the tribes of that province and some of the cities of Qūhistān are loyal to the fortress of Alamūt, and they consider Amīr al-Muʾminīn ʿAlī, peace be upon him, to be God, and they deny prayer and fasting.

120.label: text
120.text: Once, a merchant saw a *bāzyārī* who had a red and pure face and thought that the appearance of his face was due to the effect of prayer, fasting, and prostration in obedience. He said to him, "Have you done much prayer and obedience that you have such a pure face?" He replied, "What is prayer and obedience? *Tawallā* and *tabarrā* are necessary, meaning *tawallā* to Amīr al-Muʾminīn, peace be upon him, and *tabarrā* from others."

120.label: text
120.text: After that, the end of the kingdom of Khurasan is Dāmghān and Jurjān, whose northern side was Jīlān and Māzandarān, and on its southern side was ʿIrāq-i ʿAjam. And in the mountains of Dāmghān, there are two things that are famous: one is a plant that they call «Kūza Tad,» and in the books of simple medicines, they call it *jūz māthil*, and it is a poison that if someone makes an extraneous movement while digging it, with good or bad words, and then gives it to someone to eat, that person will make the same movement and say the same words.

120.label: text
120.text: And the other is that there is a well that they call «Ganda Āb,» that if they throw something impure into it, immediately clouds, wind, rain, and lightning will appear.

120.label: text
120.text: Once, a king with a large army descended near Dāmghān, unaware of the state of that

120.label: text
120.text: burkk, I have tested it myself.

121.label: text
121.text: well, and he had an enemy who he did not see the strength to fight and resist, so he sent a spy to throw something impure into that well and ambushed his army. When the rain and lightning started, everyone got wet and became preoccupied with themselves. He drove his army forward, struck them, destroyed and defeated them all, and was victorious. But there is a village in Jurjān that is a distance from ten springs from which they drink water, and there is a worm there that, when they step on it, the water in the jug becomes black and rotten. And when a group goes to fetch water

121.label: text
121.text: rwend, dar bāzgashtan kasī dar pīsh kunand tā kirmhā az sar rāh dūr kunad .

121.label: text
121.text: Once, a great man from Khurasan came to Damascus on a pilgrimage to Hejaz and told a story about the worm in a gathering. Those present taunted him, saying that he was exaggerating and speaking impossibly. Then he stayed in Damascus and sent a reporter to prepare a *maḥḍar* and bring it, stating that it was so.

121.label: text
121.text: After that is Tabrīz and the kingdom of Azerbaijan and Armenia, and the southern side

121.label: text
121.text: Kurdistan and the western border of Rūm and Mughān. And Zardusht the wise was from Azerbaijan and studied sciences in Antioch of Rūm and knew astronomy well and accompanied Yūnus the Prophet, peace be upon him, for some time, and because he observed the method of prophecy and guidance of people from Yūnus, he liked it; he desired prophecy, returned and came to Azerbaijan and stayed in Mount Sabalān, which is a famous mountain, for fifteen years. He composed *Zand* and *Pāzand* and began to preach. First, he came to Ardabīl and invited those people; they did not accept. He cursed them and said, "O God, send countless plagues so that they all perish," and from there

122.label: text
122.text: Traveled, and after a few days, snowy and cold weather began,” and it snowed continuously for three days and nights, and the houses were filled with snow, and everyone died from the cold, and from Ardabil, he turned to Khorasan and looked to see where he should go to declare his mission. He came to Balkh, and they accepted his invitation, and it was the time of Luhrāsp; he went to him and invited him.

122.label: text
122.text: invited him. Some say that he descended from the roof of Luhrāsp. Luhrāsp said, “Who are you?” He said, “I am a prophet, and I come from God to invite you to God.” Luhrāsp asked him for a miracle. One was that he had a peerless horse, and all four of its hands and feet were sunken into its body and had fallen. He said, “I want this horse to be healed by your miracle.” Zoroaster gestured four times, and the horse became well and stood up. Then Luhrāsp accepted his religion and made it famous, and Gurshāsf and Isfandiyār and Bahman all strengthened

122.label: text
122.text: promoted the religion of Zoroaster, and Iran and some of the Turks, Indians, and Arabs adopted his religion. They presented the Zend and Pāzend. He made five things obligatory for them: agriculture, generosity, honesty, non-violence, and reverence for the king, and he prescribed prayer for them three times a day and made the sun their qibla, and at sunrise, sunset, and noon, he taught them some words to recite in prayer, and the words are: Ashm wahu wa hishtam astī ushnā astī ushnā ahmāʾī hītāshāʾī wa hishtāʾī ashm ـ bitā ahū vīrbawā tā ratūsh āshāt chīt hachā wa nigih ush duzdāmunihū shīwatini nāma anghih ush mazdāʾī khushtarīhā ahurāʾī āʾīm dar gū biyuddat wa istārm. They said to Zoroaster, “How is it that this speech does not resemble anyone's speech?” He said, “Just as God does not resemble anyone, his speech also does not resemble anyone's speech.” And he declared the menstruating woman impure, and any Magian woman who menstruates, whatever she has covered and whatever she has touched, should be thrown into the desert. They leave the dead to the wind so that each of their elements may return to its center. And they build a dakhma,

122.label: text
122.text: 1 This word was added from the Russian version...

123.label: text
123.text: Where they place the dead, they spread pieces of iron, and they place narrow dakhmas next to each other in all the land so that no vegetation grows, and if a plant comes out of the dakhma, they abandon the dakhma and say that the earth is asking for protection, and they do not place the dead on the soil because they say that the soil will become impure, and any income that comes from the land will be impure, and they do not eat food and drink from earthenware vessels, and since non-violence is obligatory in their religion, they do not

123.label: text
123.text:
slaughter any animal, and they eat from the slaughtered animal of someone who is not of their religion.
The Magians say that Zoroaster is Ibrāhīm Khalīl, and this fire that we burn is the fire that did not burn Ibrāhīm. But they are lying, for Zoroaster is not Ibrāhīm Khalīl, and other Magians say that God and Iblīs are two brothers. For a thousand years, the world revolves around God, and for a thousand years, it revolves around Iblīs. Surely, Zoroaster did not say this, for it is far from wisdom. And also, Zoroaster said that paradise and hell and resurrection and recompense and punishment exist, and Ahriman and Surūsh exist, and Surūsh comes to me from God, and you must not be deceived by Ahriman and strive for goodness. Therefore, Zoroaster did not say this

123.label: text
123.text: And at the beginning of the Abbasid caliphate, the Āl ʿAbbās saw a person in Khorasan who had gone on top of a tall dome that had no way in from any side. People were amazed at how he had gone up. They asked him, “Who are you?” He said, “I am Bihzād the Magian, and I come from God to invite people to the religion of Zoroaster.” They brought him down from there, and in a short time, a thousand men gathered around him. Abū Muslim led an army against him and destroyed him.

123.label: text
123.text: After that, the northern part of the fourth clime is the kingdom of Rome up to the coast and the

123.label: text
123.text: 1 - In the “m” version, after “spread,” the phrase “and they place a dakhma in one half next to each other” appears, and this part was added from the Russian version.

124.label: text
124.text: the southern side, which is the beginning of the fourth clime, is the beginning of the land of Arabia and the land of Syria, and Mount Jūdī, where the Ark of Noah, peace be upon him, came to rest, is in Mosul, and there is a city between Mā Mardīn and ʿAkkah that they call Harrān; the buildings were all made of marble stone, extremely strong, and Hulagu destroyed it and said that if the people of this city rebel, no one can answer them.

124.label: text
124.text: And in the city of Harrān there is a place that they call Ruhā, and they have built a church that is one of the wonders, and they call it Kanīsat al-Ruhā, and they have built four columns of marble stone that are a thousand gaz in between the columns, and they have erected four arches on top of it and brought them together, and other arches are closed, like the arch of Qanṭarah Sanjah, which we mentioned in the third clime in the land of Egypt, in relation to these arches it is very small, and that church is nicely decorated and ornamented, and many lamps are hanging, and on the night of the twenty-fifth of the month of Nisan, they directly see a fire appear, and those lamps are lit. The Christians say that it is proof for us that the religion of ʿĪsā is the truth, and a group of ignorant common people who do not know that this is a trick and is also made by the Christians are deceived, and we will tell a clear proof of what that situation is, and what the Christians say, that Khidī sends a fire from the sky and the lamps are lit, is a lie. Because the situation is that the twenty-fifth of the month of Nisan was the birthday of Barkhiyān Muʿammar, and he was one of the disciples of ʿĪsā, peace be upon him, and he selected a separate Gospel from the Gospel of ʿĪsā, and on that day the Christians celebrate a holiday, and the twenty-fifth of the month of Nisan is the month of Urdībihisht in the Jalāli calendar, and the sun was at fifteen degrees of Taurus, and as God Almighty says:

124.label: text
124.text: a - Russian version: Barkhiyābīn Muʿammirān. Paris version: Barkhiyā the Prophet 2 Russian and Paris versions: was fifteen degrees.

125.label: text
125.text: درب المشرق والمغرب. So, whenever they make a piece of crystal stone round, so that it has a circular surface parallel [to the sun], when the sun shines on it, no ray can penetrate it, and the air that is tangent to the surface of the crystal will immediately catch fire. Whatever is around that crystal will catch fire, and people observe this meaning very often. That clever¹ people hold a white-surfaced bowl in front of the sun and rub some tallow in the middle of the bowl, and it catches fire, even though it is not as hard as crystal. And if a piece of stone is made in this way in the west, and the degree of the sun on that day is made right to that degree, so that when the sun sets, the center of the crystal and the sun are right, and a thin string or a piece of silk that is not visible is greased with naphtha oil so that if a wind comes, it will not put it out, because other oils do not have that strength, and one end of it is connected to the crystal and the other end to the lamps, so that it includes everything. And when the fire appears on the surface of the crystal, the thin string will immediately catch fire and all the lamps will be lit, and no one's hand will be in between, and they will say that the fire has come down from the sky, and the crystal stone must be installed on a height so that if someone happens to see the fire, they will see it coming from above to the ground and away from the lamps. So that if sometimes there is a cloud at sunset and the sun does not shine in the window, they can secretly set fire to that

125.label: text
125.text: و چند نوبت شنیده ایم که در بغداد میخهای آهنین که در چوب و

125.label: text
125.text: نی زده اند در خانه ها آتش افتاده بدان و سوخته .

125.label: text
125.text: وحيلتي و فریبی دیگر که ناگاه آتش پدید می آید ، آن است که

125.label: text
125.text: ۲ نسخه پاریس : پنبه در میان جسام

126.label: text
126.text: سنگی هست که آن را سنگ زیت میخوانند که چون آب بر او می ریزند ، شعله آتش از آن می جهد و چون روغن میریزند فرو می نشیند و ما ذکر این

126.label: text
126.text: سنگ در شرح اقلیم سوم یاد کردیم .

126.label: text
126.text: و خواجه نصیرالدین طوسی در تنسوق نامه ایلخانی آورده که پاره ای از این سنگ در موضعی تعبیه کرده باشند و ریسمانی یا پاره ای ابریشم بر این موجب که گفتیم بر این سنگ بسته باشد و سردیگر همه قنادیل را رسانیده و کسی برسبیل آنکه فراشی کند آب بر او افشاند ، آتش از او افروخته شود و در آن ریسمان گیرد و قندیلها روشن شود و چون ریسمان باريك باشد از دور ننماید و زبانه آتش بینند که می آید و به فتیله قنادیل می پیوندد و هيچ شك نيست از كسى كه خيك آب داشته باشد و فراشی کند تصور آتش نکرده باشد تعجب کند و حال آنکه تعجب در آن کلیسا است و آن استادیها که چگونه بر سر آن چهار ستون با مسافتی چنان بعید طاقها بسته اند و کلیسیا ساخته .

126.label: text
126.text: بعد از آن دریای فرنگ است و جزیزه قبرس قریب صدوده فرسنگ طول و شصت فرسنگ عرض آن جزیره است و همه ترسا باشند و اگر کسی به آنجا رود که نه از دین ایشان باشد تعذیب دهند و کارهای سخت فرمایند و شب محبوس کنند . و آنجا کلیسیائی بغایت بزرگ است و نعمت بیحد خلایق در آنجا جمع کرده اند و [ از ] چندین بازرگان که در اطراف عالم با مایه تمام تجارت میکنند ، چنین استماع افتاد که از اموال کلیسیا باشد و مردمان عزب و دختران به موافقت عیسی مجرد زنید و در کلیسیا طاعت و صورت عیسی و مریم ساخته اند و بر بلندی نهاده .

126.label: text
126.text: و در قبرس نقره و سیماب و الماس و دهنج و قلعی فراوان باشد و

126.label: text
126.text: کان زاج [ سیاه ] است که بهتر از زاج کرمانی بود .

126.label: text
126.text: ۱- این کلمه از نسخه روسیه و پاریس افزوده شد .

127.label: text
127.text: And on the coast of the Sea of Cyprus, on the northern side, there is a city that they call Mā Qad wa Niyā,

127.label: text
127.text: میخوانند و هم از این اجناس که ذکر کردیم [ دارد به تخصیص الماس والماس ما قيدوني مشهور باشد و چون هوای فرنگ و جزیره قبرس نزديك هوای یونان است مردمش لطیف طبع وزيرك باشند و دور دایم [ و ] چیزهای بدیع می توانند ساخت . چه بسیاری از حکما داعیه آن دارند که دور دایم بسازند و نتوانند .

127.label: text
127.text: شخصی حکایت کرد که بازرگانی فرنگی هر سال به تبریز به تجارت می آمد و مرا با او دوستی ، پیداشد چنانکه بی مشورت من هیچ معامله نکردی روزی گفتم میخواهم که ملک شما ببینم و می ترسم که مسلمانان را عذاب می کنند و شب محبوس میکنند و اگر خواهد که برود نمی گذارند . فرنگی گفت تو همراه من بیا به عهده من که باز ترا به تبریز بیاورم میگوید که رفتم و بسیار عجايبها بدیدم . از آن جمله چرخی دیدم که پره از چوب داشت بر سر چاهی آب و چنان ساخته بودند که آن پره ها بر میخاست و باز برهم می نشست و آب از چاه میکشیدند و اگر میخواستند که آب نیاید سنگی بزرگ بر سر آن پره مینهادند تا بر نخیزد و چون میخواستند که دگر بار آب از چاه بیرون آرند ، سنگ بر میداشتند ، بی محرکی چرخ در حرکت می آمد و آب از چاه بیرون می آورد .

127.label: text
127.text: و فرنگیان و ترسایان ، رهبانی دارند که بر آن ملك حاكم بود ومال کلیسیا به تصرف و فرمان او باشد و مجرد زید و از طفلی چند کس ملازمت او کنند تا متعرض زنی و آرزوئی و شهوتی نشود و نسبت به عیسی علیه السلام او را مجرد تربیت کنند . و فرنگیان در طلب علم بسیار کوشند و در محفل ضرطه رها کنند

127.label: text
127.text: ۱- این قسمت از نسخه روسیه افزوده شد .

128.label: text
128.text: And they do not consider it a defect if hiding wind in the stomach causes colic. But the way of the Hindus is worse, and there is a people who curse sneezing and vice versa for farting. And in Frank there is a white stone that resembles talc, and when they hold it in front of their eyes, things appear larger, and they make many for those whose eyesight is weak and who read fine script, because things and lines appear larger. That is because when sight penetrates it, it becomes thick, and it certainly appears larger than it is. Just as a barley grain or a grape that is thrown into a glass full of water appears larger than it is.

128.label: text
128.text: After that, there is the sea that continues to the west to the encircling sea, and several islands in between. And when it is about one hundred and fifty leagues from the encircling sea, the width of the sea becomes less, and there are many cities on the northern and southern sides that are coasts. Among them is a city on the southern coast that is called Andalus, and in the west of [Andalus] there is a desert and wilderness that is called Vādī Naml, and there are some large ants that eat people. And in Andalus, they have made a statue of a horse and a man out of copper, and they have mounted the man on the horse, and with the wisdom of a talisman, they have made that statue of a man move his hand as if he is calling someone, meaning come, and he moves his hand back, meaning do not go, it is Vādī Naml, they will eat you. And it is said that one of the things that the wise men have made is that it moves all the time without a motivator and guides people.

128.label: text
128.text: But then in the north of this sea coast, near the west, there is a mountain and a city that was called the Cold City in ancient times, and it is called that now, and the cave of Aṣḥāb al-Kahf is in that mountain. Arisṭāṭālīs the Wise has written a book on natural science.

128.label: text
128.text: 1 and 2 These two words were added from the Russian version.

128.label: text
128.text: ۱ و ۲ این دو کلمه از نسخه روسیه افزوده شد .

129.label: text
129.text: He has composed and said that time is movement, and whoever is unaware of movement is also unaware of time, just as several people slept for years in the cave of the Cold Mountain, and when they woke up, they thought that only an hour or two had passed. And Aṣḥāb al-Kahf were nearly a thousand years before Arisṭāṭālīs, and when Aṣḥāb al-Kahf came out from before Daqyānūs, it was a four-day journey to the Cold Mountain, and Daqyānūs was the king of the West, and Arisṭāṭālīs is called the First Teacher because the first sciences were dead; before him, they were taught orally. When Aflāṭūn heard that Arisṭāṭālīs had compiled the sciences and put them in writing, he was offended and said, "He has taken away the honor of the sciences." They said, "How?" He said, "When science is compiled, everyone can enter without a master, and science and teacher are always despised."

129.label: text
129.text: One day, Iskandar says to Arisṭālīs, "Make a composition for me that will never be abrogated and that the people of religions will need." He made logic and named it the science of thought-measuring. But then there is a large city that is called Salb, and a sea with two islands, and the position of Qalṭiyānūs was in those areas, and in this vicinity there is much land and mountains, and useful medicines and plants can be obtained.

130.label: text
130.text: On the Mention of the Fifth Clime

130.label: text
