130.text: The first place in the far east of the fifth clime is the impossible lands of Yaʾjūj and Maʾjūj, and several large mountains in the middle of the mountain's opening where Iskandar built a dam, and from the beginning of the fourth clime to the seventh clime, this mountain stretches to the point where the end of construction is on the northern side, and likewise that mountain goes to the coast of a sea where there is a large island that is called Ġāzinyā, it is about two thousand and seven hundred leagues, and that mountain is named Qāf. It is said because Mount Qāf has risen around the world, which is three sides of the quarter of habitation of the encircling sea, and one northern side that is land without plants or animals and uninhabited, and there is no sea. This mountain stretches so that one end is connected to Mount Qāf to the dam of Iskandar and the mountain of Yaʾjūj, which is in the far east, and the other end is on the coast of the sea of

130.label: text
130.text: 1- Original: ʿārnyā Correction based on the Russian and Paris versions.

131.label: text
131.text: However, after that, the regions of Yaʾjūj and Maʾjūj are extensive, stretching from the fourth to the seventh clime. Three sides are mountains and the Barrier of Iskandar, and one eastern side is the surrounding sea. From there is the Sea of Devils, and a large stream of water comes and falls into a narrow mountain valley with a steep descent, goes to the city of Yaʾjūj, and joins the surrounding sea. The regions of Yaʾjūj and Maʾjūj lie in a hollow, with the south side being hot and the north side being cold. Another river enters the mountains of Yaʾjūj and also joins the surrounding sea.

131.label: text
131.text: Once, one of the Abbasid caliphs, who was called Wāṯiq, appointed two men. One went and observed the Barrier of Iskandar, and one went to the far west and saw the Cave of the Companions and brought news to Wāṯiq, and they recounted what they had learned. The one who had come to see the Barrier of Iskandar said that near the barrier there is a hard stony ground and a very difficult path."

131.label: text
131.text: The distance from Baghdad to the Barrier of Iskandar is greater than to the Cave of the Companions. And they say that the Barrier of Iskandar is red in color, and it must indeed be so, as God Almighty says that Ḏū al-Qarnayn said, «اتوني زبر الحديد حتى إذا ساوى بين الصدفين» [Bring me blocks of iron, till when he had filled up the space between the two mountain-sides].

131.label: text
131.text: And when iron sees moisture and rain, it rusts, and the color of rust is red. Alchemists obtain rust from iron, and that rust is red, and they call it *zaʿfarān al-ḥadīd*, which turns yellow when applied to silver.

131.label: text
131.text: After that, there is a city called Kashīna, and in that vicinity are Turks, Mongols, Zard Qabā, Natar, and the like, and they worship idols, and most of that people have

131.label: text
131.text: ۱- This part is taken from the "m" version. Red color

131.label: text
131.text: ۲ In the original text: bar āvard va

132.label: text
132.text: have no religion or creed, and they eat the meat of dogs and other wild animals, and they strangle sheep to death and do not slaughter them.

132.label: text
132.text: After that, there are many mountains and two lakes. Whenever a cloud appears over those mountains, it is red in color, and this is due to the earthly elements that have risen with the vapor.

132.label: text
132.text: After that is the end of the land of Khitai, and a desert and a mountain where ermine, squirrel, sable, musk deer, and others are abundant.

132.label: text
132.text: After that, there are several long mountains, and the beginning of the land of Turkestan, and Khānbāligh, and a city that Afrāsiyāb built, and there is a mountain in that vicinity where there is a mine of *dahanj*, and it absolutely resembles ruby. But Frankish *dahanj* is better, and they make vessels from it and cherish it. After that are Qaraqorum, Bish Baligh, Albaligh,

132.label: text
132.text: Khotan and Kashghar, and most of this place is cold.

132.label: text
132.text: After that, the beginning of the fifth clime, which is the southern side, there are several cities from Transoxiana, and the northern side, which is the end of the fifth clime, is Taraz, Shash

132.label: text
132.text: After that, the Sea of Khwarazm and the rivers Jihun and Sayhun that go to Khwarazm

132.label: text
132.text: and Gurganj and Kat were Khwarazm.

132.label: text
132.text: After that, the Sea of Abeskun, which they call Khazar, cuts a distance of about fifty *farsakhs* in the sea, and Qarabagh, Mughan, Arran, Shemakha, Basarda, Tbilisi, and Rudkar, and the Aras River, which comes from the region of Georgia and goes to the Sea of Abeskun

132.label: text
132.text: After that, there is a mountain and a thicket and trees, and they call it Mount Alborz

132.label: text
132.text: بعد از آن دریای آبسکون که خزر میخوانند ، قرب پنجاه فرسنگ مسافت در یا قطع کند و قراباغ و مغان و اران و شماخی و بسردع و تفلیس و و رودکر و رود ارس که از ناحیه گرجیست می آید و به دریای آبسکون

132.label: text
132.text: بعد از آن کوهی است و بیشه و درخت و آن را کوه البرز

132.label: text
132.text: میخوانند و در آن حوالی قومی هستند که ایشان را سکسار می گویند و

133.label: text
133.text: The faces of their women are beautiful, and if they find a stranger, they seize him and put him inside, and they throw sweet apples to him from above, and inevitably, since there is nothing else, they eat it, and when a few days pass, they become fat, they kill and eat them, and if their women have the opportunity, they release them, and they say that in that mountain and thicket there are many strange animals.

133.label: text
133.text: And there are other people who have very thin legs, and they call it *duwāl pā*, and there are other groups who have tails like monkeys, thin ones that have grown from their rear, and the people of that province often fight with the Seksar. After that, there are several very large mountains that are the source of the Tigris and Euphrates from

133.label: text
133.text: And after that, the kingdom of Qūniya, ʿAmūriya, and Greater Rūmiya, and after that Constantinople, Macedonia, and the gulf that extends from the Sea of Rum, and the city of Athens, which is *madīnat al-ḥukamā* [the city of the wise].

133.label: text
133.text: When the religion of Islam gained strength and the Muslims were victorious in battle and it became known that the army of Islam, every wound they inflict is effective and no wound from sword, arrow, ax has any effect on them, a complete fear and dread fell upon the people of Rum, and all that was gold and silver, they made it all into buried treasure and wrote treasure maps and went to Constantinople, which is a very large city and has abundant blessings and is farther from the land of the Arabs, on the seashore, and those treasure maps were kept safe and collected in a box, and most of the owners of property and treasures disappeared and scattered, or died, or endowed the Monastery of Constantinople, and now whoever serves that monastery for a year, after a year his reward is to open the box and

133.label: text
133.text: a Russian version: and since they cannot find anything else, they inevitably eat that cause.

134.label: text
134.text: The treasure map is brought out, and they see how much there is and where it is; they give it to that person, and this matter is well-known.

134.label: text
134.text: And in Rome, they find a great deal of human mummia, which is a dead person placed in a grave in the middle of honey. And in the cities and provinces of Egypt, there are also many from the tombs of the ancients. And these days, some Muslims in Egypt and Baghdad make wills that we should be buried in honey so that we become mummia, so that people may be comfortable who are sick; it is better than decaying and rotting in the soil, and worms falling into our bodies and rotting us.

134.label: text
134.text: After that, from Constantinople to the island of Cyprus is one hundred farsangs of land and

134.label: text
134.text: After that, when they pass this place, there is a sea and a large island. After that, there is another sea that they call the Sea of ​​Alexander, and that sea was cut by Alexander, and it was a populated province with many people, and he conquered the people of that province and appointed someone to govern. When Alexander was absent, they killed the ruler and became rebels. He returned again and conquered. And they still rebelled and drove out the ruler. The third time, too, in this way, after he knew that they would not obey, he told the sages to be careful whether the surface of this land is higher or the surface of the sea. They said that in the state of *mudūd*, the surface of the sea is higher, and in the state of *jazr*, there are several provinces and mountains in the middle of this sea. And they took precautions, and the vicinity of the city that they call Istanbul was closer to the sea, and water was taking over that province of rebels, and he ordered seven thousand mountains with a width of seven hundred *gaz* to be cut and brought to a small amount up to the edge.

135.label: text
135.text: Water, and at the time of *jazr*, which is from the late morning, there were many people at work until they opened the whole road and went from there and descended to the height. At the end of the day, which was the beginning of the increase in sea water, water fell in that province, and when it was day, it was all sea, and all the people and other animals perished, and several sides that were on the height of the city went in, and they saw that a town remained, still appearing as a long island, and several mountains and hills that were in the middle were all uninhabited islands, and the length of that province that was flooded and became a sea is nearly one hundred and seventy *farsangs*, and sixty *farsangs* wide.

135.label: text
135.text: After that] it is nearly one hundred *farsangs* of sea with several islands. After that, there are the provinces of Qusanṭuniyya, Ṭarṭūna, Ṭulayṭula, and Qulabra up to the seashore, which has several populated and inhabited islands. Qusanṭuniyya is different from Qusṭanṭiniyya, and this is the name of an ancient city and province in the Greek language, and most of this province has the religion of Jesus the Prophet and live with wise qualities, and in several places there are Muslims, and in some they cannot be, such as Cyprus, which we mentioned, that they give hardship and

135.label: text
135.text: And in these provinces, most of the medicines and beneficial plants are abundant, and silver, mercury, and brass are abundant, and the weather is pleasant, and there are various types of plants, animals, and strange fruits, and there is a plant that, when rubbed on silver, turns it into gold, and for two months they cultivate that plant, it becomes the spirit of elixir, and when that plant is eaten by cows and sheep, it gives a lot of milk, and in the land of Sham and Azerbaijan, too, this plant has been found, and when the spring season ends, it is the end of the plant.

135.label: text
135.text: ¹- Original: Because the spring season this plant.

136.label: text
136.text: The first place of the sixth clime is in the farthest east, the middle] of the regions of Yaʾjūj and Maʾjūj and the Barrier of Alexander, and the beginning of Mount Qāf, and the area of the length of Madīnat Yaʾjūj and Maʾjūj is nearly four hundred *farsangs* on the coast of the surrounding sea in the fourth and fifth climes, instead of the regions of Yaʾjūj, it becomes narrower towards the north up to the foothills of Qāf and the end of the seventh clime, and after that there are mountains and a very dense and large and small rocky area.

136.label: text
136.text: But after that, there is a desert, and the first of the lands of Qipchaq was cold, and sable, squirrel, ermine, and other animals whose skins they wear are abundant, and that people mostly eat the meat of animals, and in the summer they live in herds, and the sheep are tailless, and in these areas there are people who have a tail of four fingers joined together growing from their anus, and despite their good looks, they are beastly and savage, and they have little hair on their bodies.

136.label: text
136.text: ¹- The word "*wasaṭ*" [middle] has been taken from the "M" manuscript and the Russian version.

137.label: text
137.text: However, after that is a long mountain, and to the north of this mountain is a good land

137.label: text
137.text: in a pit, extremely swampy and rotten, such that a person perishes from the stench and infection of that land

137.label: text
137.text: After that are many mountains, and the source of the long Āʾīl River and the Sayḥūn was there

137.label: text
137.text: The long Āʾīl River flows for nearly seven hundred farsangs and passes through the region of Bulgar and joins the Khwārazm Sea. The Sayḥūn River also travels about the same distance and

137.label: text
137.text: joins the Khwārazm Sea in the fifth clime.

137.label: text
137.text: And after that is the province of Tibet, and it is nomadic and has a great distance,

137.label: text
137.text: such that at times merchants would stay among their livestock for nearly a month

137.label: text
137.text: There is another province near the province of Tibet on the west side, which they

137.label: text
137.text: call Zāgh, and navel musk is abundant in Tibet, and after the musk of Khitāʾī, the musk of Tibet is good, and the navel is no more than four or five mithqāls and has little hair.

137.label: text
137.text: After that is Jabal Aṣfarān and the Khwārazm Sea, an extremely cold province, and there is always snow on this mountain, and around this mountain, it is so cold that few people settle and do not establish a residence, but it is not without cold-weather animals, and the people who settle there spend six months of autumn and winter in warm houses. Like bathhouses, they have opened under the houses and always burn fire, and from the sides of the houses, they open holes so that the heat of the fire enters the house and warms the house, and there are many sheep in that area, and all the time dīg-i bark

137.label: text
137.text: (Russian version: dīg-i pukhta barkar, with a fathah on the bāʾ and kāf) in the dialect of the foothills of Alborz means a large pot.

138.label: text
138.text: have put it on the fire. If someone goes from one house to another, they give them hot soup and āsh to drink, and after that, they go out so that the cold does not affect them, and when they come out of the

138.label: text
138.text: house, they do not stop until they reach another house that is warm. After that is Sarman Rāʾī, which a group calls Sarāy-i Barkān. And the northern side of Sarman Rāʾī is Bulgar and Rūs, and most of the people of that province are Muslims. And Bulgar is at the end of the sixth clime, and when the sun is in the sign of Gemini and Cancer, the evening twilight and the true dawn are connected, and earlier than sunset, the morning twilight rises, according to this verse: « ان الصلوةَ كَانَتْ عَلَى المُؤْمِنِينَ كتاباً موقوتا » [Q. 4:103] prayer is not obligatory for them as a spoil, because they do not have the time for the last evening prayer, and when the time of  حتى تيبين لكم الخيط الأبيض من الاسود من الفجر comes, they will not find it, and there was also discussion about fasting in Ramaḍān. In this area, which is the end of the sixth clime, [the night] is eight hours, and during these eight hours, the twilight and dawn are separated from each other, and when the day returns and it becomes winter, the length of the day is also

138.label: text
138.text: eight hours, and the kings of Bulgar give sermons and mint coins in the name of Alexander,

138.label: text
138.text: they say that we are from the lineage of Alexander, and this is not so, except that they are from a tribe that goes back to Filīqus, the father of Alexander. Because Alexander never had intercourse with a woman to the extent that the wise men said that Dārāb has a sixteen-year-old daughter, of extreme beauty; let us choose her so that you may have intercourse with her once, and God may give you a son to take your place, Alexander did not agree and said, I do not allow my body to rub against the body of a woman.

138.label: text
138.text: 1 In the original, " بزرگان corrected from the version of the National Library and the Russian version 2- Original: تصحیح corrected from the version of the National Library and Russia.

139.label: text
139.text: Also, in the area of Bulgar and Rūs, there are people who buy human skulls with curly black hair for a high price

139.label: text
139.text: and hang them in their houses, considering them sacred and boasting about them, saying that so-and-so has a black flag, and anyone who does not have that head in their house is not considered important, unless they do not have

139.label: text
139.text: After that is the Khazar Sea, and in the middle of it is an island that they call Barkān; indeed, Sarman Rāʾī, which is famous as Sarāy-i Barkān, is that. And Sarman Rāʾī was at the beginning of the clime of Bulgar and at the end of the sixth clime, and there are many Bactrian camels, and in the middle of both climes, it was more numerous and better, and in the end of that region where Bulgar is located, from east to west, the altitude of the sun at noon in winter is seventeen degrees or eighteen degrees, like the afternoon in Iraq and Kermān, and when the dragon's tail node is in the sign of Virgo and Libra, in any month that the moon is in Sagittarius and Capricorn, its maximum altitude is twelve degrees, whatever season of the year it may be.

139.label: text
139.text: After that, when they pass through Khazar, there is a desert and several cities that

139.label: text
139.text: they call Harqala and Harīna, and that province was nomadic and the end of the kingdom of Rūm

139.label: text
139.text: and Frank. After that, a gulf extends from the sea and comes to the seventh clime on the northern side, and there is another city that is nearly seven hundred farsangs from the far west and the seashore and an island that they call ʿUbūr al-Faras and Wasaṭ Baḥr Nīṭus, and there are several mountains in the south of this province, and in this distance, there are many cities and provinces, and its people are intelligent and wise, and none of them are Muslims, and they have different religions and beliefs, and some are such that they do not know religion or nation, and the cold regions are moderate, and the air in this area is better than the air in Bulgar and

140.label: text
140.text: Russia was more pleasant, and a mountain from the vicinity and coast of the sea extends to the east at the beginning of the sixth clime, which is nearly three hundred leagues, and it is called the Kūh-i

140.label: text
140.text: Shār, and it is extremely beneficial, and there are many medicines and animals.

141.label: text
141.text: In the seventh clime, buildings and settlements are fewer compared to other climes, and there are many uninhabited mountains and deserts, and the animals are extremely large and harmful, some of which can cause death just by seeing and looking at them. And at the end of the seventh clime, it is mostly at the foot of the Kūh-i Qāf in the eastern half.

141.label: text
141.text: After that, the first place from the farthest east in the seventh clime is the end of the districts of Yaʾjūj and Maʾjūj, and the beginning of the Kūh-i Qāf, which is connected to the barrier of Iskandar

141.label: text
141.text: Furthermore, there is a mountain in the south of the seventh clime, extending nearly three hundred and fifty leagues, and on the northern side of this mountain is a very deep place, and there are savage people there who have human faces and do not come up from those areas, and no one goes there, and they have little cultivation and agriculture, and it is extremely cold, and from the beginning of autumn to the end of winter they do not see the sun because there are several mountains that are extremely tall and raised in their south, which cast a shadow of several leagues in the shortness of the day

142.label: text
142.text:
In winter, it casts a shadow of several leagues, and at the end of autumn and the beginning of winter, the darkness is greater, and the night is extremely long, and the day in winter is no more than five or six hours. And the closer one gets to the Kūh-i Qāf, the greater the difference between day and night and the more severe the cold becomes. And at the end of the seventh clime, which is the foot of the Kūh-i Qāf and the end of buildings, when the sun is in the first degree of Capricorn, it is all night, and when it is in the first degree of Cancer, it is all day, and that people, because the sun shines less on them and they do not see the body and rays of the sun for several months each year, [have weak eyesight because the rays of luminous bodies weaken the light of sight. And that people cannot make pots and bowls from clay, either because of the extreme cold or because they do not know how.
And a group of merchants goes to trade with these people and takes brassware and cotton, and that people have woolen goods such as qāqum, sanjāb, samūr, fanak, and ʿalā hādhā, and during the day the merchants place their goods on top of a mound, and they come at night and place something in return for each item of the merchants, and a mutual agreement is reached in absentia, and the transaction is finalized.

142.label: text
142.text: After that is the province and districts of a people who are called Iḥtisāj, and they are also a type of Qipchaq, and savage in nature and lacking intelligence, like animals, and in the north of this place are many mountains, and a strong stream of water comes from both sides of the mountain and a lake appears, and in the middle of it are savage and evil people, if they see a stranger not in their shape and form, they seize and burn them, and most of the food of

142.label: text
142.text: that people is the hunted meat of wild animals

142.label: text
142.text: After that is the city of Ṭayfūr, and we mentioned Ṭayfūr in the first clime.

142.label: text
142.text: 1 - Russian version: Iḥtishāj. Paris version: Iḥtiyāj.

143.label: text
143.text: It often happens that two countries or two cities or two places have the same name, just as Ṭarābulis of Syria and Ṭarābulis of the Maghreb, and another Barbarah of Zanj and Barbarah which is in the middle of Abyssinia

143.label: text
143.text: After that, there is a city and a province and a people in those districts who know nothing.

143.label: text
143.text: After that, there is a city and a province and a people in those districts who know nothing.

143.label: text
143.text: After that, there is a lake and flowing water and several deadly deserts and

143.label: text
143.text: And after that, there is a high mountain, and water comes from that mountain, and a lake has appeared in the foothills of that mountain, and that lake is called ʿUnfawān, and because of the extreme cold it is frozen all the time, and the north of this lake is the foothills of the Qāf mountains; there is no habitation or people, and if there is, it is very little, and there are some animals whose sight causes destruction, and some deadly animals that people die from looking at them.

143.label: text
143.text: When Iskandar reached the seventh clime, wherever he dismounted, he sent some horsemen to the sides and directions to bring him news and information, and he sent a group to the Qāf mountains, but they did not return [and the second time he sent another group, they did not return, and the third time as well. Arisṭāṭālīs says that there must be an animal on this side whose sight causes destruction. Iskandar said, How can we know and what is the cure? He said, Order a large, bright and polished mirror to be made, and have several people hold the mirror in front of them and carry it, and follow the horsemen from behind the mirror until they reach the dead men and horses; when that animal's gaze falls on the mirror and

143.label: text
143.text: ۱- This part is quoted from the Russian version.

144.label: text
144.text: sees its own image, it will die. They did so, and it was so.

144.label: text
144.text: How is it that an animal has been seeing itself all this time and has not died?

144.label: text
144.text: Poison is in the snake's mouth; when it hunts and eats something, it certainly contaminates its mouth with poison, and then swallows it; nevertheless, the snake does not die, and its meat is not poisonous; they eat it and make tablets. Because snake venom is in the snake's mouth and the snake's temperament is natural, and anything that is natural is not harmful or deadly, and this animal has all its limbs natural. Also, this cause of destruction is on the head and eyes of that animal. Perhaps if someone sees the back of it, they will not die.

144.label: text
144.text: Then it must be that if there are two such animals, if they see each other,

144.label: text
144.text: That other animal is either its child or of its kind. For example, if an infant is given a needle dipped in poison, it will not be so deadly, and if a little more of that poison is added every few days, when it grows up, the poison will become natural to it, and if it eats a mithqal of that poison, it will not die, and if it completely abandons it, a disease will appear. This animal has seen it from the first day or it was born from it, so seeing that

145.label: text
145.text: animal from the first day, whose gaze is deadly like its own, is natural to both of them. Unlike seeing itself in the mirror in a way that it has never seen before, that form and appearance seems contrary to the rule, it is unnatural, and since the characteristic of that animal is that seeing it causes destruction, whenever it sees its own head and eyes in a strange form, it dies.

145.label: text
145.text: Abū ʿAlī Miskūyah Iṣfahānī has mentioned in Nuzhat-nāmah-i ʿAlāʾī that in this region of the seventh clime, which is near the Qāf mountains and is a desert and uninhabited, there is an animal of extreme size, more than what comes to the imagination of man, and it is called Ṣinājjah, and there are several other vipers of extreme size, whose sight causes destruction, and this viper weighs two thousand manns, and in relation to the Ṣinājjah, it is a small worm, and the viper is really afraid of the Ṣinājjah, and the viper knows what its characteristic is, and when the Ṣinājjah intends to attack the viper and sees it, the viper dies, and if it finds it, it destroys and eats it, and the viper is always fleeing from the Ṣinājjah, and sometimes it suddenly passes in front of the Ṣinājjah, and when the Ṣinājjah, while unaware of the viper, its gaze falls on it, it immediately dies. And this has the same form that we said that anything that appears contrary is harmful and deadly. And since the Ṣinājjah dies in that state when it is unaware of the viper, it is prey for animals for a while, and since it is cold, it remains in that valley for days and does not crumble.

145.label: text
145.text: After that, at the end of the seventh clime, it belongs to Gemini and Cancer.

145.label: text
145.text: The day was twenty-two hours and twenty-three hours, and the end of the seventh clime is twenty-four

146.label: text
146.text: Hours pass, and when the sun reaches the meridian circle, its ultimate altitude

146.label: text
146.text: Twenty-four degrees and twenty-five degrees, and the mountains have much shadow, and the beginning and end of the day are longer, and when the day returns and the sun comes to Sagittarius or Capricorn, this amount of twenty-three hours or twenty-four hours is all night, and for a while no one sees the sun, and if there is sun, no one can observe the solar disk because the mountains and hills on the south side are a barrier, and the shadow

146.label: text
146.text: Stretches several leagues, and for this reason that place is called ẓulumāt.

146.label: text
146.text: And Iskandar traveled around the world for the water of life, and they said that in ẓulumāt is the water of life, and for this reason he came to ẓulumāt, and this is a metaphor that there is no water of life in the world, and no one lives forever. Qāla Allāh taʿālā (وَمَا جَعَلْنَا هُم

146.label: text
146.text: جدا لا يأكلون الطعام وما كادوا خالدين).

146.label: text
146.text: However,] There are many mountains in the foothills of Mount Qāf, and a large body of water comes from those mountains, and it is called Nahr Ṭanā Barsā, and it joins a sea that is the Gulf of the Maghrib Sea, and the southern part of this river, which is the middle of the seventh clime,

146.label: text
146.text: is the end of the lands of Qipchaq and there are several cold cities.

146.label: text
146.text: Near Mount Arsānīyā is a place where they trade in absentia, just as we mentioned before that there are Nūmī who are invisible to people

146.label: text
146.text: and they are the same in this place.

146.label: text
146.text: And there is a valley in a pit and in the foothills of a mountain from Bulgar to nearly two hundred leagues to the north, and when the sun is in Sagittarius and Capricorn, they have four or five hours of daylight. When the sun is in Gemini

146.label: text
146.text: 1- The original and Paris version have Qamar instead of solar disk, corrected from the Russian version. 2 Russian version: Ṭanā Qirsā.

147.label: text
147.text: And when Cancer arrives, they have twenty hours of daylight, and in the lands of Qipchaq it is also

147.label: text
147.text: It takes shape with a little difference in relation to the northern and southern positions.

147.label: text
147.text: After that, a cold place is called the end of the lands of Russia, a gulf from another gulf that also stretches from the seventh clime, and in the middle of that gulf there are long islands that are one hundred and fifty leagues wide and it is called Jazīrat al-Biʾr, and in it there are several wells and pits and hollow ground, including a well in which when a stone is thrown, it sinks a little and then returns and falls out and no one knows its secret, and my prevailing opinion is that vapor has made its way to that well when there was an earthquake, and in cold places where there is a lot of sea water and moisture, vapor rises from the well more and more strongly, and like a spring of water vapor comes all the time and the stone falls out from where there is continuous vapor. For example, we see that children place a grain of grape on the head of a piece of open-ended reed and blow air into it, the grain of grape is carried into the air from the head of the reed and comes back, and the harder they blow into it, the higher and higher it goes.

147.label: text
147.text: and several cities that are Bartās and Bazaq

147.label: text
147.text: After that, there is another well in which the aṣḥāb ṣināʿāt say that there is sulfur aḥmar, which is the spirit of elixir, and when they project it on bodies, it turns into gold, and no one can bring that sulfur because it is suffocating and has a strange vapor, but it can be brought out with wisdom in such a way that they make two long sleeves from the top to the bottom of the well so that wind can come out from its sides, and two people put two blacksmith's bellows on it and blow air into that sleeve so that fresh air goes down and

147.label: text
147.text: Foul air comes out, and whoever has gone to that well inhales the air

147.label: text
147.text: that has gone to the sleeve

148.label: text
148.text: After that, north of this island, which is the foothills of Mount Qāf, there is a people

148.label: text
148.text: whose faces resemble those of dogs and are located between the two seas of Nahr Ṭanā Barsā and Mount Qāf, and those areas are called the Muḥālāt Kalābiyya and it is cold, but these places are less so in relation to the eastern sides.

148.label: text
148.text: After that, in the south of this large and small gulf, which is the beginning of the seventh clime

148.label: text
148.text: and the end of the sixth clime, they say that there is a well that no matter how much rope they put into that well, it does not reach the bottom of the well.

148.label: text
148.text:
After that, when they pass through this gulf, on the south side, which is the beginning of the seventh clime, is the land of Bāshqirdā, which is nearly three hundred leagues long and one hundred and fifty
leagues wide, and on the north side, which is the end of the seventh clime, is the sea and
a large island that is called Jazīrat Ghārnibā, and that island is populated
and there are many creatures, plants and animals, and one hundred and thirty leagues is the length and width
of this island, and they say that on this island there is a tree that is extremely large
and rooted and old, that when the sun is in Aries, whoever asks it any question,
they will hear the correct answer from it.

148.label: text
148.text:
And they say that when the sun was in Aries, Iskandar with
a large army boarded a ship and went to this island and asked several questions of this tree. One question was what has become of the state of my life, the answer came little, he knew that his life was coming to an end. And the other question was whether Iskandar

148.label: text
148.text: will see his mother again or not? The answer came no.

148.label: text
148.text: Deprivation befell Iskandar that he would not see his mother and the kingdom of Rome. When

148.label: text
148.text: 1 - Russian version: Bāshqrū. Paris version: Māstrū. 2- This section from

149.label: text
149.text: As Alexander's life drew to a close, he sent several letters of testament and messages to his mother, one of which was that when news of my condition reaches you, announce it so that anyone who has suffered a calamity or event may not come to inquire after you. This is so that his mother knows that this state and affliction that has befallen her is not exclusive to her, and this calamity has befallen all the people of the world. [However, after that, on the southern side of this island of Ghazniya, which is north of the island and the lands of Ba Shafarad, is the land of Saqlaniya, with sea, mountains, water, and streams flowing on all sides.]¹ After passing the island of Ghazniya, on the western side are two other islands, each fifty farsangs in length and thirty farsangs in width. Men inhabit one island, and women inhabit the other, with about thirty-five farsangs of sea between them. They have specific times when the men board ships and go to the island of women, spending two or three days in pleasure and enjoyment, and then return to their own island, striving for construction and agriculture. If a woman bears a son after he is four years old, they send him to the island of men, and if they bear a daughter, they leave her there. Some say that all the women are unmarried and accustomed to it.

149.label: text
149.text: On this island, there is a tree that sprouts branches and leaves in the spring, and any woman who eats a few leaves from it becomes pregnant. If she bears a son, they send him to the island of men, and if it is a daughter, they leave her with them. It is said that these women have a queen who is also a woman, and she commands all of them to earn their necessities and means of livelihood.

149.label: text
149.text: ¹ This part was added from the Russian version. Correction from the Russian and Paris versions and version M).

150.label: text
150.text: Alexander wanted to observe this island and the women. Everywhere, he went as a messenger, saying, "Alexander has sent me." The purpose was that he boarded a ship and went to the island of women, saying, "Alexander has sent me." The queen of the women had a picture of Alexander embroidered on a garment and said, "You are Alexander," and brought the picture and placed it before him, saying, "I can kill you, but it is not customary to kill a world-conquering king. Return safely, and do not make any mistake with us, lest we become enemies of men." It is said that these women are very beautiful

150.label: text
150.text: After passing this island of men and women and Ghazniya, there is another long island, about one hundred and thirty farsangs in length and thirty farsangs in width. Due to its size, this island is called Umm al-Jazāʾir (Mother of Islands). To the north of this are several other islands, large and small, called Jazāʾir Bāqir. All the other islands are inhabited, with plants, animals, flowing water, meadows, mountains, and deserts. Because there is no dry land around the islands, the cold is relatively

150.label: text
150.text: milder, and the people are good-looking.

150.label: text
150.text: After that, to the south of these islands, which are in the middle of the seventh clime, there are two large islands, one of which is at the beginning of the clime and the other in the south, with the southern one being larger and more populated, about one hundred and ten farsangs in length and width. These islands that we have mentioned all lie in a sea and gulf that, at the end of the seventh clime, from the far west of the encircling sea, stretches for thirty farsangs.

151.label: text
151.text: has stretched and comes to an end at the foot of the Qāf mountain.

151.label: text
151.text: After passing this sea and these islands, there is a prosperous country and province with many cities and countless people, mountains, deserts, flowing water, and abundant meadows. From the beginning of the seventh clime to the end of the seventh clime, which is the limit of civilization, from the west and the coast of the encircling sea, all the cities, towns, villages, and places of settlement for livestock and desert-dwelling people are connected. That entire province is called the land of Burtāniyā. The first place is called the kingdom of Burtāniyā, and a middle place and a last place, ʿalā hādhā, and relative to that, it has a tropical and climate. They have much silver and mercury, but less gold. It is about three hundred farsangs wide and four hundred farsangs long, and the names of the other cities have been given in the Arabic language and are now known in the Greek language, and this is called the kingdom of Burtāniyā. Between these two kingdoms of Burtāniyā, a gulf has stretched from the encircling sea, about one hundred and fifty farsangs long and fifteen farsangs wide,

151.label: text
151.text: However, as we have made clear, construction and settlement are more abundant in the far west of the seven climes than in the far east. The people there are entirely flawed, imperfect, misshapen, monstrous, and evil, and they are fewer in the far west. We will explain this in two ways: First, in the far east and the islands of Dardī Akhḍar, which have entered the first clime, and in the other six climes, there is no sea that causes purity, humidity of air, and

151.label: text
151.text: moderation. The air and cold winds in the far east are more and harsher than in the far west, relative to each clime separately. For this reason, dullness of nature and bestial characteristics are more prevalent in the way of the far east than what people are in the far

152.label: text
152.text: Another reason is that the planets have a full effect in the inhabited quarter [of the Earth]

152.label: text
152.text: and in the far east, when the planets rise from the sea, they shine on the earth at a time that is the locus for receiving the planets' beneficence, which before that was the encompassing sea

152.label: text
152.text: and pure, simple water that has no capacity. قال الله تعالى يدبر الأمر من السماء إلى الأرض , Every degree that rises from the earth, the sun rises, and other planets appear as well. Beneficence becomes synonymous and increases [and when it reaches the middle of the inhabited quarter, abundant beneficence is gathered, and when the sun and stars reach the west and set, they leave behind and hide all the beneficences, and for these two reasons, people in the middle of the world and the western half are more intelligent, discerning, and affluent, and construction and prosperity are greater, and defective and flawed people are fewer.

152.label: text
152.text: After that, the end of the seventh clime from the north, as we said, is such that when the sun is in the first of Cancer, it is all day, and when it is in the first of Capricorn, it is all

152.label: text
152.text: But after that, we have drawn five lines outside the seven climes, where there is no construction, animals, or plants. The first line is a place where there is a full day for one month of the year, and a full night for one month, and the rest are both day and night together, and the

152.label: text
152.text: second line is a place where there are two months of full night in the year, and two months of full day, and the rest are night and day together. The line after that is where there are three months of full day in the year, and three months of full night, and the rest are day and night together. And in the fourth line is a place where there are four months of full night in the year, and four months of full day, and the rest are night

152.label: text
152.text: 1- This part was added from the Russian version.

153.label: text
153.text: and day together. And on the fifth and last of these lines is the North Pole, with six months of

153.label: text
153.text: day and six months of night.

155.label: text
155.text:
11/5- مسطح کرهی is incorrect; the correct term is سطح کرهی. Dārā 9/16 وارطه apparently is the same word as وراطه on p. 6, line 17. Diyā 17/2- کرم مکنت and on p. 35, line 23 کرم نکت, and in the Russian version «انکت» and in the Paris version مکت are given. What is the correct form?
The word is unknown.

155.label: text
155.text: « بربر» (Berber) appears in later pages as بر بره. It is possible that کیه

155.label: text
155.text: letters have fallen off the end. Kā

155.label: text
155.text: ١/٢٠ - بجز باباء متصل صحيح ا است .

155.label: text
155.text: 2/38 ذو الخليصه was recorded with a yāʾ in all versions, and apparently this is incorrect. ذو الخلصه without a bāʾ was a temple downstream from Mecca that ʿAmr b. Luḥayy erected, and he hung necklaces around the idol's neck, including a necklace made of ostrich eggs (أقرب الموارد). 7044 We do not know of a place called Mūghān on the southern coasts of Iran; perhaps this word is the modern-day Minūjān, which was originally in the form Manūghān.

155.label: text
155.text: 3/45 The hair-worshippers are the same as the Ṣāʾīn, the remnants of whom are still in Ahwaz and Khorramshahr

155.label: text
155.text: 15/45- لو كان قاتل عمرو غير قاتله. is correct. These two verses have been seen in various forms. For example, in the Muntahā al-ʾĀmāl, it is in this order:

155.label: text
155.text: لو كان قاتل عمرو غير قاتله

155.label: text
155.text: بكيته ابدأ ما كنت في الأبد

155.label: text
155.text: لكن قائله من لا نظير له

155.label: text
155.text: (Muntahā al-ʾĀmāl by Shaykh ʿAbbās Qummī, in Ghazwaʾ al-Khandaq)

155.label: text
155.text: 3/56- زاج is apparently the village of Zārch on the road from Ardakān to Yazd, near to the city of Yazd, and it still exists today.

156.label: text
156.text: ۵۶ / ۱۴ اسفنجود ظاهراً باید به شکل اسفنجرد باشد که مخفف اسفندیار جرد است یعنی شهری که اسفندیار ساخت .

156.label: text
156.text: ۶ / ۵۹- ظاهراً شكل جمله بدین ترتیب صحیح است روزی شیخ جمال بصری که او در چاغ سلطان غازان در فارس حاکم بود سواره در حوالی قبر جاماسب بگذشت . چاغ به معنی زمان است و صاحب برهان قاطع این کلمه را با حرف قاف ضبط کرده است . ۶ / ۶۵- قیشاره ظاهراً قيسار به است که شهری است بر ساحل بحر شام از اعمال فلسطين که میان آن و طبریه سه روزه راه است . قیساریه دیگری در بلاد روم است که

156.label: text
156.text: پایتخت سلاطین سلاجقه روم بوده است ( معجم البلدان ) .

156.label: text
156.text: ۸ / ۶۸- ده فرسنگ ظاهراً صحیح نیست و دو فرسنگ چنانکه در نسخه روسیه آمده صحیح است . ۱۵/۶۸ - سمك ( بفتح سین و سکون میم و ( کاف به معنی سقف خانه یا از قسمت بالا تا پایین بنا و قامت و بلندی هر چیز است . سمك مناره یعنی بلندی و ارتفاع آن ( اقرب الموارد ) ۲۱/۷۱ - سنة سبع و تسعين وستمائه هجری پیش از خروج چنگیز نمی شود چه چنگیز در سال ۶۱۷ خروج کرده است و ظاهراً سنة ۵۹۷ صحیح است .

156.label: text
156.text: ۳۷۳- عبارت بدین شکل باید اصلاح شود :

156.label: text
156.text: و بعد از آن قحط رو با در شام زلزله ای سخت شد .

156.label: text
